Title: Sr. Data Analyst, Generative AI
Description:
About Pinterest

Millions of people around the world come to our platform to find creative ideas, dream about new possibilities and plan for memories that will last a lifetime. At Pinterest, we’re on a mission to bring everyone the inspiration to create a life they love, and that starts with the people behind the product.

Discover a career where you ignite innovation for millions, transform passion into growth opportunities, celebrate each other’s unique experiences and embrace the flexibility to do your best work. Creating a career you love? It’s Possible.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in analyzing Pinterest datasets and developing sophisticated knowledge systems to extract insights at scale. You will lead advanced data analysis and development efforts to uncover trends that inform key strategic initiatives utilizing a wide range of Gen AI tools, models, and workflows. Collaborating closely with various teams, you will create insightful reports and tools driven by AI, effectively generating and synthesizing insights to guide business strategies. With a global remit, you will empower markets and partners by providing valuable insights, especially where dedicated resources are unavailable.

What You’ll Do


Data Strategy: Master the Pinterest dataset and collaborate with colleagues and cross-functional partners to explore future analytical opportunities that uncover advertiser value through data analysis and your generative AI expertise
Data Visualization: Design and create visual representations from data sources to enhance understanding and analysis. Leverage generative AI to dynamically support dashboards, automate data narratives, and create interactive visual tools that explain complex user behavior. Use LLMs to automate the synthesis and distillation of insights into actionable recommendations at scale.
Workflow Design: Develop a clear data system to extract advertiser-relevant insights from the Pinterest dataset, establishing effective processes and solutions. Develop AI-powered automation to continuously enrich, categorize, and summarize large-scale data assets for decision making. .
Collaboration and Mentorship: Provide technical guidance to team members, colleagues, and clients to ensure clarity and optimal use of developed dashboards
Execution Excellence: Independently drive the execution of specialized and complex insights deliverables and AI-enhanced analytics solutions development.



What We’re Looking For


+5 years of experience working with large data sets and developing data visualization solutions, particularly for sales organizations application
Proven expertise in data visualization tools such as Tableau and Looker, with familiarity in advanced custom visualization platforms like Retool, Streamlit, or Plotly DashProficient in Python and highly skilled in SQL, with a track record of using these tools to query, analyze, and synthesize large datasets.
Experienced in leveraging generative AI frameworks and APIs (e.g., OpenAI, LangChain) to automate data analysis and insight generation.
Skilled in designing pipelines for document ingestion, embedding, storage, and indexing—optimizing document retrieval for LLM-powered systems.
Strong business and product acumen, with the ability to transform vague questions into well-defined analyses and success metrics that inform business decisions.
Excellent communication skills, capable of leading initiatives across multiple product areas and articulating findings to leadership and Insights teams.
Experience in leading key technical projects and significantly influencing the scope and outputs of others, with strong project management skills to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Demonstrated agility in managing ambiguity, with a strong ownership mindset to independently devise solutions to challenges and identify new opportunities.
Understanding of user-centric design principles to ensure intuitive and actionable dashboards and visualizations for non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and critical thinking, with a commitment to continuous learning and adaptability in emerging data technologies and methodologies.
Experience working across regions with a sensitivity to cultural differences, ensuring effective communication and collaboration with diverse teams.
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a relevant field such as Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or equivalent experience.



Relocation Statement:


This position is not eligible for relocation assistance. Visit our PinFlex page to learn more about our working model.



In-Office Requirement Statement


We let the type of work you do guide the collaboration style. That means we're not always working in an office, but we continue to gather for key moments of collaboration and connection. This role will need to be in the office for in-person collaboration and therefore needs to be in a commutable distance from the New York, Chicago, San Francisco or Seattle office.



At Pinterest we believe the workplace should be equitable, inclusive, and inspiring for every employee. In an effort to provide greater transparency, we are sharing the base salary range for this position. The position is also eligible for equity. Final salary is based on a number of factors including location, travel, relevant prior experience, or particular skills and expertise.

Information regarding the culture at Pinterest and benefits available for this position can be found here.

US based applicants only

$120,082—$247,228 USD

Our Commitment To Inclusion

Pinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, status as a protected veteran, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information or characteristics (or those of a family member) or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require a medical or religious accommodation during the job application process, please complete this form for support.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Envoy builds workspace management technology that makes it simple to run secure, compliant, and connected workplaces across every location. Over 16,000 workplaces and properties around the world rely on Envoy to create great experiences for employees and visitors while meeting safety, security, and compliance needs at scale. From corporate headquarters and labs to manufacturing sites, Envoy powers the places where people work best together.

Learn more at envoy.com

About The Role

We are a data-driven organization that values analytical rigor, innovation, and collaborative impact. Our team maintains high standards across our modern data stack, engineering practices, and analytical frameworks while fostering a culture of continuous learning and diverse perspectives.

We're seeking an experienced data professional to accelerate our analytics capabilities and drive strategic decision-making across the organization. You'll collaborate with product, marketing, sales, and engineering teams to deliver actionable insights, build predictive models, and influence key business decisions through data storytelling and evidence-based recommendations.

Our data platform is built on a modern stack including AWS Redshift, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, dbt, and Airflow for orchestration. We leverage Looker and Databricks for analytics and exploration. We're actively exploring real-time analytics solutions, MLOps tooling like SageMaker, MLflow, and Feature Stores, as well as incorporating generative AI use cases using LangChain, LLM APIs, and vector databases.

This is an on-site position that requires 4 days a week (Monday-Thursday) in our San Francisco HQ.

You will

Strategic Analysis & Insights


Partner with cross-functional teams to design and execute high-impact analytics projects that drive product strategy and business growth
Develop sophisticated analyses using modern statistical methods, machine learning, and causal inference techniques
Conduct deep-dive investigations into user behavior, product performance, and market trends


Advanced Analytics & Modeling


Build and deploy predictive models, recommendation systems, and forecasting solutions
Design and implement robust A/B testing frameworks and analyze experimental results
Create automated reporting dashboards and real-time monitoring systems


Data Leadership & Strategy


Influence product roadmap and business strategy through compelling data narratives and executive presentations
Establish analytics best practices and data governance standards
Mentor junior analysts and contribute to team knowledge sharing


Innovation & Research


Explore emerging analytics techniques, including generative AI applications for data analysis
Evaluate and implement new tools and technologies to enhance analytical capabilities
Contribute to our data science research initiatives and thought leadership


You are

Technical Excellence


You have exceptionally high standards for data quality and analytical rigor, understanding that trust in data is fundamental to business impact
You're pragmatic about balancing perfection with delivery timelines, always striving for excellence while maintaining velocity
You think systematically about data architecture, measurement frameworks, and end-to-end analytical processes


Business Acumen


You're an owner who takes personal accountability for outcomes and proactively identifies opportunities for improvement
You thrive in fast-paced environments where your work directly impacts product decisions and business results
You have strong product intuition and can translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations


Growth Mindset


You're passionate about continuous learning, staying current with emerging tools, methodologies, and industry best practices
You're intellectually curious and eager to explore new analytical approaches and technologies
You value feedback and actively seek opportunities to improve your craft


Collaboration & Communication


You're emotionally intelligent and prioritize team success over individual recognition
You excel at explaining complex analytical concepts to diverse audiences, from engineers to executives
You're empathetic and supportive, particularly when mentoring junior team members


You have

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or related quantitative field
5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or related roles
Proven track record of influencing business strategy through data-driven insights


Technical Skills


Expert-level SQL proficiency with experience in modern data warehouses (Redshift,Postgres, Databricks)
Advanced Python skills with deep knowledge of data science libraries (pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn)
Experience with modern analytics tools such as dbt, Looker, Tableau, or similar. Hands-on expertise with dbt for building modular, version-controlled, and testable data transformation pipelines.
Proficiency in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and experimental design
Working knowledge of version control (Git) and command-line tools


Analytical Expertise


Strong foundation in applied statistics, regression analysis, and machine learning
Experience with A/B testing, causal inference, and experimental design
Ability to create compelling data visualizations and interactive dashboards
Experience with time series analysis and forecasting techniques


Bonus points

Advanced Technical Skills


Experience with cloud platforms including AWS (preferred), GCP, and Azure, with a strong understanding of modern data infrastructure and services.
Knowledge of machine learning operations (MLOps) and model deployment
Familiarity with real-time analytics and streaming data processing


Business & Leadership


Track record of success in fast-paced startup or scale-up environments
Experience leading cross-functional analytics projects
Background in product analytics, growth metrics, or business intelligence
Experience with modern experimentation platforms and statistical methods


Emerging Technologies


Familiarity with generative AI tools and their applications in data analysis
Experience with automated reporting and self-service analytics platforms
Knowledge of data mesh architectures and modern data governance frameworks


You'll get


High degree of autonomy and trust in your analytical judgment
Direct impact on product strategy and business outcomes
Mentorship opportunities and career development support
Collaborative environment with talented, diverse team members
Opportunity to shape the future of workplace technology through data

Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Envoy to process your application. Envoy is an EEO Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any characteristic protected by local, state or federal law.

Compensation Range: $162.5K - $180K

HTML:
Envoy builds workspace management technology that makes it simple to run secure, compliant, and connected workplaces across every location. Over 16,000 workplaces and properties around the world rely on Envoy to create great experiences for employees and visitors while meeting safety, security, and compliance needs at scale. From corporate headquarters and labs to manufacturing sites, Envoy powers the places where people work best together.

Learn more at envoy.com

About The Role

We are a data-driven organization that values analytical rigor, innovation, and collaborative impact. Our team maintains high standards across our modern data stack, engineering practices, and analytical frameworks while fostering a culture of continuous learning and diverse perspectives.

We're seeking an experienced data professional to accelerate our analytics capabilities and drive strategic decision-making across the organization. You'll collaborate with product, marketing, sales, and engineering teams to deliver actionable insights, build predictive models, and influence key business decisions through data storytelling and evidence-based recommendations.

Our data platform is built on a modern stack including AWS Redshift, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, dbt, and Airflow for orchestration. We leverage Looker and Databricks for analytics and exploration. We're actively exploring real-time analytics solutions, MLOps tooling like SageMaker, MLflow, and Feature Stores, as well as incorporating generative AI use cases using LangChain, LLM APIs, and vector databases.

This is an on-site position that requires 4 days a week (Monday-Thursday) in our San Francisco HQ.

You will

Strategic Analysis & Insights

  • Partner with cross-functional teams to design and execute high-impact analytics projects that drive product strategy and business growth
  • Develop sophisticated analyses using modern statistical methods, machine learning, and causal inference techniques
  • Conduct deep-dive investigations into user behavior, product performance, and market trends

Advanced Analytics & Modeling

  • Build and deploy predictive models, recommendation systems, and forecasting solutions
  • Design and implement robust A/B testing frameworks and analyze experimental results
  • Create automated reporting dashboards and real-time monitoring systems

Data Leadership & Strategy

  • Influence product roadmap and business strategy through compelling data narratives and executive presentations
  • Establish analytics best practices and data governance standards
  • Mentor junior analysts and contribute to team knowledge sharing

Innovation & Research

  • Explore emerging analytics techniques, including generative AI applications for data analysis
  • Evaluate and implement new tools and technologies to enhance analytical capabilities
  • Contribute to our data science research initiatives and thought leadership

You are

Technical Excellence

  • You have exceptionally high standards for data quality and analytical rigor, understanding that trust in data is fundamental to business impact
  • You're pragmatic about balancing perfection with delivery timelines, always striving for excellence while maintaining velocity
  • You think systematically about data architecture, measurement frameworks, and end-to-end analytical processes

Business Acumen

  • You're an owner who takes personal accountability for outcomes and proactively identifies opportunities for improvement
  • You thrive in fast-paced environments where your work directly impacts product decisions and business results
  • You have strong product intuition and can translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations

Growth Mindset

  • You're passionate about continuous learning, staying current with emerging tools, methodologies, and industry best practices
  • You're intellectually curious and eager to explore new analytical approaches and technologies
  • You value feedback and actively seek opportunities to improve your craft

Collaboration & Communication

  • You're emotionally intelligent and prioritize team success over individual recognition
  • You excel at explaining complex analytical concepts to diverse audiences, from engineers to executives
  • You're empathetic and supportive, particularly when mentoring junior team members

You have

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or related quantitative field
  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or related roles
  • Proven track record of influencing business strategy through data-driven insights

Technical Skills

  • Expert-level SQL proficiency with experience in modern data warehouses (Redshift,Postgres, Databricks)
  • Advanced Python skills with deep knowledge of data science libraries (pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn)
  • Experience with modern analytics tools such as dbt, Looker, Tableau, or similar. Hands-on expertise with dbt for building modular, version-controlled, and testable data transformation pipelines.
  • Proficiency in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and experimental design
  • Working knowledge of version control (Git) and command-line tools

Analytical Expertise

  • Strong foundation in applied statistics, regression analysis, and machine learning
  • Experience with A/B testing, causal inference, and experimental design
  • Ability to create compelling data visualizations and interactive dashboards
  • Experience with time series analysis and forecasting techniques

Bonus points

Advanced Technical Skills

  • Experience with cloud platforms including AWS (preferred), GCP, and Azure, with a strong understanding of modern data infrastructure and services.
  • Knowledge of machine learning operations (MLOps) and model deployment
  • Familiarity with real-time analytics and streaming data processing

Business & Leadership

  • Track record of success in fast-paced startup or scale-up environments
  • Experience leading cross-functional analytics projects
  • Background in product analytics, growth metrics, or business intelligence
  • Experience with modern experimentation platforms and statistical methods

Emerging Technologies

  • Familiarity with generative AI tools and their applications in data analysis
  • Experience with automated reporting and self-service analytics platforms
  • Knowledge of data mesh architectures and modern data governance frameworks

You'll get

  • High degree of autonomy and trust in your analytical judgment
  • Direct impact on product strategy and business outcomes
  • Mentorship opportunities and career development support
  • Collaborative environment with talented, diverse team members
  • Opportunity to shape the future of workplace technology through data

If you have any questions related to compensation, please contact Recruiting after you apply.

Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Envoy to process your application. Envoy is an EEO Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any characteristic protected by local, state or federal law.

Compensation Range: $162.5K - $180K

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Based in San Francisco, Arine is a rapidly growing healthcare technology and clinical services company with a mission to ensure individuals receive the safest and most effective treatments for their unique and evolving healthcare needs.

Frequently, medications cause more harm than good. Incorrect drugs and doses costs the US healthcare system over $528 billion in waste, avoidable harm, and hospitalizations each year. Arine is redefining what excellent healthcare looks like by solving these issues through our software platform (SaaS). We combine cutting edge data science, machine learning, AI, and deep clinical expertise to introduce a patient-centric view to medication management, and develop and deliver personalized care plans on a massive scale for patients and their care teams.

Arine is committed to improving the lives and health of complex patients that have an outsized impact on healthcare costs and have traditionally been difficult to identify and address. These patients face numerous challenges including complicated prescribing issues across multiple medications and providers, medication challenges with many chronic diseases, and patient issues with access to care. Backed by leading healthcare investors and collaborating with top healthcare organizations and providers, we deliver recommendations and facilitate clinical interventions that lead to significant, measurable health improvements for patients and cost savings for customers.

Why is Arine a Great Place to Work?:

Outstanding Team and Culture - Our shared mission unites and motivates us to do our best work. We have a relentless passion and commitment to the innovation required to be the market leader in medication intelligence.

Making a Proven Difference in Healthcare - We are saving patient lives, and enabling individuals to experience improved health outcomes, including significant reductions in hospitalizations and cost of care.

Market Opportunity - Arine is backed by leading healthcare investors and was founded to tackle one of the largest healthcare problems today. Non-optimized medications therapies which cost the US 275,000 lives and $528 billion annually.

Dramatic Growth - Arine is managing more than 18 million lives across prominent health plans after only 4 years in the market, and was ranked 236 on the 2024 Inc. 5000 list and was named the 5th fastest-growing company in the AI category.

The Role:

The Senior Data Analyst role will report to the Reporting and Analytics Manager and will work within the Product Insights team. This role will be responsible for leading the development and implementation of data-driven analytics for one or more of our product offerings. The Senior Data Analyst will conduct in-depth analyses of data, identify leading indicators, and provide meaningful interpretation of metrics and trends. The role will be a leading voice in our analytic workstreams, working cross-functionally with BI developers, engineers, customer success executives, and product.

What You'll Be Doing:


Lead and manage data analysis projects across cross-functional teams, ensuring timely delivery, accuracy, reliability and completeness
Drive meaningful interpretation of data findings, translating raw data into operational insights
Build comprehensive analytics frameworks to evaluate complex datasets and monitor key performance metrics
Identify and develop leading indicators to predict product performance and outcomes
Write efficient SQL queries and develop automated data pipelines to perform deep-dive analyses
Create and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards using data visualization tools to communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders
Develop subject-matter expertise in our product offerings and supporting operational and performance data
Collaborate with data science, customer success, and product teams to ensure that data analyses remain efficient and effective in supporting business objectives over time
Stay ahead of the latest trends and technologies in BI, data analytics, and data visualization to improve our BI capabilities continuously


Our Ideal Candidate Possesses:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
5-7 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or related field
Demonstrated track record of leading complex analytical projects from conception to implementation
Expertise in extracting, analyzing, and interpreting complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights to inform business processes
Advanced SQL proficiency and practiced with data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or similar
Proven ability to act autonomously, take initiative and be innovative
Substantiated ability to work independently, exercise sound judgment, prioritize multiple projects, and solve problems under tight deadlines and limited resources
Excellent written, interpersonal communication and presentation skills, including ability to present complex technical concepts in a clear, concise manner to audiences with varying levels of technical understanding
Experience with statistical analysis is a plus
Experience with healthcare is a plus


Remote Work Requirements:


An established private work area that ensures information privacy
A stable high-speed internet connection for remote work
This role is remote, but you will be required to come to on-site meetings multiple times per year. This may be in the interview process, onboarding, and team meetings


Perks:

Joining Arine offers you a dynamic role and the opportunity to contribute to the company's growth and shape its future. You'll have unparalleled learning and growth prospects, collaborating closely with experienced Clinicians, Engineers, Software Architects, and Digital Health Entrepreneurs.

The posted range represents the expected salary for this position and does not include any other potential components of the compensation package, benefits, and perks. Ultimately, the final pay decision will consider factors such as your experience, job level, location, and other relevant job-related criteria. The salary range for this position is: $145,000-$160,000/year.

Job Requirements:


Ability to pass a background check
Must live in and be eligible to work in the United States


Information Security Roles and Responsibilities:

All staff at Arine are expected to be part of its Information Security Management Program and undergo periodic training on Information Security Awareness and HIPAA guidelines. Each user is responsible to maintain a secure working environment and follow all policies and procedures. Upon hire, each person is assigned and must complete trainings before access is granted for their specific role within Arine.

Arine is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees are treated with fairness and respect. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other legally protected status. Our hiring decisions and employment practices are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply and join us in our mission.

Check our website at https://www.arine.io. This is a unique opportunity to join a growing start-up revolutionizing the healthcare industry!

Job Offers: Arine uses the arine.io domain and email addresses for all official communications. If you received communication from any other domain, please consider it spam.

Note to Recruitment Agencies: We appreciate your interest in finding talent for Arine, but please be advised that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies. All resumes submitted to Arine without a prior written agreement in place will be considered property of Arine, and no fee will be paid in the event of a hire. Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
About Us

Highwire is a modern strategic communications and digital marketing agency designed for disruptive companies. We work with high-growth technology companies and established brands looking to reinvent themselves.

At Highwire, we believe that storytelling fuels transformation. And the most impactful stories represent all voices and perspectives. As a values-driven agency, we foster an inclusive environment where everyone—regardless of age, race/ethnicity, size, shape, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion and different abilities–can feel safe, celebrated and worthy.

We ensure every Highwire Walker has unique support to climb to success. Our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging is permanent and foundational to our business and culture. We aspire to change our industry and build a better future for all.

Our people-first culture is driven by four core values:


Team Empowerment
Growth Mindset
Inclusion Always
Fierce Distinction



We’re looking for individuals with big ideas, strong opinions, and the energy to bring them to life. If you thrive in an environment that values personal accountability, high standards, and boundless motivation, this is the opportunity for you. Be part of our award-winning culture and contribute to an exciting and growing business where you can make a real impact.

About The Role

The Analyst, Highwire Intelligence Group will play a crucial role in delivering actionable, data-driven insights to support client strategies. You’ll dive into the world of data to craft compelling narratives that empower our clients in the fast-evolving technology and healthcare sectors. If you’re excited about the intersection of data, technology, and communications and are eager to contribute to building a leading agency capability, this role is perfect for you.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze social media, web, and traditional media data to generate insights that inform strategic communications and marketing decisions
Media Monitoring & Listening: Develop and execute Boolean queries to monitor conversations across social media and online news platforms, identifying emerging trends and themes
Data Visualization & Storytelling: Build engaging and insightful data stories and visualizations using tools like Google Sheets, Google Slides, PowerPoint and Tableau to communicate key findings
Performance Measurement: Use analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Sprout Social, Meltwater) to assess content performance and provide recommendations for optimization
Market Research: Conduct market and competitor analysis to establish baseline knowledge and uncover opportunities
Automation & Tools: Leverage tools like Excel, Quid, and AI-driven platforms for efficient data collection and analysis
Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams, including account leads, to integrate data insights into broader communication strategies



Qualifications


Experience: 2-5 years in analytics, preferably in PR, marketing, or advertising, with a focus on technology and healthcare sectors
Technical Skills: Proficient with Google Suite (especially Sheets and Slides), data visualization tools, and media monitoring software (e.g., Quid, StatSocial, SimilarWeb)
Data-Driven Mindset: Passionate about working with data to derive insights and confidence in translating these into actionable recommendations
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present data clearly and persuasively
Attention to Detail: Highly organized, with excellent time management and a keen eye for detail
Critical Thinking: Capable of identifying trends and solving strategic problems using data
Digitally Savvy: Familiarity with social platforms and emerging trends in digital and social media



What You'll Gain


Experience working with high-profile clients, exposure to cutting-edge analytics techniques, and the opportunity to shape strategies that drive real impact in the technology and healthcare spaces



Highwire Perks


Competitive salary
Merit-based bonuses and promotions
Hybrid work model to suit your schedule and lifestyle
Excellent vacation policy including extended break for summer and winter holiday
Participate in Empower Hours on Fridays; Team has the ability to log off by 3pm
401K Match
Medical and dental benefits/ FSA
Paid Parental Leave
Commuter Benefit
Growth Mindset Stipend of $100 annually for books, exhibitions, etc
Technology reimbursement
Wellness benefit
Donation Match
Mentorship
Monthly recognition programs
Employee referral bonus
New business referral bonus
Quarterly Highwire fun events – Thanksgiving is our favorite holiday
Dog friendly work environment
Extremely supportive, nurturing environment with many opportunities for learning and growth



⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯

The duties delineated above will vary depending on the needs of each specific account, and in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. This individual will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisors.

We are actively seeking candidates who possess a genuine passion for tech PR and are excited to expand our team. As we continue to grow our agency, we are proactively building a pipeline of exceptional individuals to connect with and consider for future opportunities.

If you are enthusiastic about the world of tech PR and are eager to embark on a rewarding career in this field, we encourage you to start the conversation by applying today. We value your interest in our agency and look forward to hearing from you.

Apply now and let's explore the possibilities together!

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯

Job Alert

If you have been targeted by a scammer, you can file a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission here. Highwire will not send recruiting-related emails from any other email domain name or variation other than @highwirepr.com. Highwire will never request your bank account, credit card, or credit score as part of our application process. If you receive a suspicious email not sent from a team member, specifically at our @highwirepr.com email address, or if you receive suspicious outreach on social media, please forward the communication to hwsecurity@highwirepr.com so that we can review and flag the fraudulent domain and user IDs for removal.

Salary is based on a range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills, other job-related qualifications, and geography.

This individual will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisors.

We are actively seeking candidates who possess a genuine passion for tech PR and are excited to expand our team. As we continue to grow our agency, we are proactively building a pipeline of exceptional individuals to connect with and consider for future opportunities.

If you are enthusiastic about the world of tech PR and are eager to embark on a rewarding career in this field, we encourage you to start the conversation by applying today. We value your interest in our agency and look forward to hearing from you.

Apply now and let's explore the possibilities together!

Job Alert

If you have been targeted by a scammer, you can file a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission here. Highwire will not send recruiting-related emails from any other email domain name or variation other than @highwirepr.com. Highwire will never request your bank account, credit card, or credit score as part of our application process. If you receive a suspicious email not sent from a team member, specifically at our @highwirepr.com email address, or if you receive suspicious outreach on social media, please forward the communication to hwsecurity@highwirepr.com so that we can review and flag the fraudulent domain and user IDs for removal.

Salary is based on a range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills, other job-related qualifications, and geography.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst (Growth)
Description:
Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. Here’s a secret: there's no such thing as a "perfect" candidate. Poshmark is looking for exceptional people who want to make a positive impact through their work and help create an organization where everyone can thrive. So whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this role would make you excited to come to work every day.

Job Description

Poshmark is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Growth Analytics team. In this role, you'll partner closely with our Growth Team stakeholders to transform actionable insights that drive marketing performance and business outcomes by helping shape and optimize strategies across paid channels.

This is a high-impact role for someone who loves using data to solve real business problems. You’ll spend your time analyzing trends, building dashboards, and collaborating cross-functionally to improve traffic quality and campaign effectiveness.

Responsibilities

This role will be focused on providing analytics support and data insights to major business operations areas at Poshmark, including Growth, Marketing, Retained Growth, and Communications.


Provide data-driven insights that lead to actionable business recommendations for key stakeholders in a simple, clear, and compelling manner. Understand and meet their analytics needs on a continual basis
Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and partner with internal team members to identify opportunities for improvement
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, correlations, and insights
Develop new or improve existing key metrics and performance indicators to evaluate business performance, and work with the Data Engineering team to implement the data collection needed
Think and work independently, demonstrate creativity, and deliver quick results, while demonstrating a team-player attitude
Work effectively with cross-functional teams; learn and apply best practices from other teams and always strive for high quality deliverables
Maintain required documentation to ensure inventory of all key findings from trends and growth opportunities
Perform extensive QA to ensure the quality and integrity of data. Follow the standard process for reporting any issues identified and work with the appropriate Data teams to resolve any data issues


6-Month Accomplishments


Learn the ins-and-outs of Poshmark’s platform and operations: developing familiarity with our key business stakeholders, data, goals, KPIs, and how they relate to Poshmark’s overall business
Gain expertise of Poshmark's internal data systems and platforms and the use cases for each
Contribute to projects by working on analyses and investigations with assistance from your manager and the broader team
Ensure built-in time and process to QA data and insights
Provide input and recommendations to achieve project goals


12+ Month Accomplishments:


Take on projects with growing independence with support from manager wherever required
Develop insight and knowledge of long-term trends and factors influencing the business and our operations
Demonstrate ability to lead conversations with and present data-driven analysis to business stakeholders and partners
Become subject matter expert of your domain, with the ability to answer questions, and give guidance
Mentor teammates and data analysts on the team


Requirements


3+ years of analytics experience
Strong data mining skills using SQL with proficiency in Excel. Exposure and familiarity with Python, R, Spark SQL preferred
Understanding of data modeling concept and partnering on building new DW tables
Experience in gathering requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting
Experience with data visualization through Looker (or similar tool) is preferred
Knowledge of basic statistical concepts with emphasis on statistical hypothesis testing (t-tests, z-tests, etc.). Experience with A/B and multivariate testing is preferred
Ability to communicate data at an appropriate level for the audience
Detail-oriented and expert in both qualitative and quantitative analysis, with strong storytelling and presentation skills
Strong business acumen with aptitude to apply it critically towards solving problems
Excellent interpersonal skills — including written and oral communication skills


Salary Range

$115,600.00 - $164,700.00 Annual

Poshmark is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

View Poshmark's Job Applicant Privacy Policy here.
Show more

Title: BI Reporting Analyst III - Remote
Description:
Responsibilities

A client with Kforce is seeking a BI Reporting Analyst III to join their team. This is a remote opportunity. This role will join the CoM DS team to support key metric and funnel definitions, improve performance and stability of data pipelines, and build stable reporting across CoM products. The BI Reporting Analyst will maintain and enhance foundational data pipelines that power self-service analytics, automate critical reporting workflows to significantly reduce manual efforts, and ensure pipelines are consistently refreshed with new or seasonal data. This role also involves collaborating with stakeholders to leverage standardized test reporting frameworks to make business decisions. In Season:


Maintenance of the Data Foundations layer needed to supercharge self-serving capabilities for "CoM Product reporting"
Automation of in-season KPI reporting and opportunity identification on CoM products to reduce the weekly lift


Out Of Season


Improve existing CoM reporting capabilities - We have existing pipelines and reporting dashboards for Fast Money products: RAD/ERAD, RT, XDE, and CKM that need to be shored up through defining key funnel metrics, identifying more stable backend metrics in place of front end clickstream, optimizing pipeline performance, and improving business facing reporting
Build and/or collaborate with other analytics enablements teams on New CoM reporting capabilities for short-term lending products (FNPL, RiL) with similar functions - define key metrics using backend source of truth where available, leverage best practices for data pipeline performance and quality, and business facing reporting
Develop self-serve capabilities for CoM testing to drive consistency with those used for relevant funnel / product scope areas (ie. FnF, Shopping)


Requirements


Strong SQL and data modeling skills
Experience building scalable data pipelines (expertise in BI tools)
Proven track record of working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making
To be considered for this position, candidates must have experience in a similar role, or they must possess significant knowledge, experience, and abilities to successfully perform the responsibilities listed
Relevant education and/or training will be considered a plus


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Analyst Contractor to support our Expense Manager with data-driven insights and reporting. This role will focus on analyzing financial and operational data, building reports, and supporting budgeting and forecasting efforts with a strong emphasis on data accuracy and visualization.


Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain monthly reporting packages using Excel and BI tools
Analyze expense data to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for cost optimization
Support budget entry and updates across systems
Assist with 2026 forecasting by preparing historical data sets and scenario modeling
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data consistency and integrity

Tools & Systems

ERP: NetSuite (experience with other ERPs is welcome)
BI Tool: Tableau (used primarily on the revenue side; nice to have)
Other: SQL experience is a plus for data extraction and transformation





Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®





Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.





Robert Half works to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - whenever you choose - even on the go. Download the Robert Half app and get 1-tap apply, notifications of AI-matched jobs, and much more.





Robert Half will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit roberthalf.gobenefits.net for more information.





© 2025 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to Robert Half’s Terms of Use.

Title: Principal Insights Analyst, LMS Customer Insights
Description:
Company Description

LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description

This position can be performed in New York City or San Francisco depending upon which location the applicant chosen for the role is currently residing.

At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business. The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.

At LinkedIn we believe that marketing is what accelerates business growth and that nearly all the levers of business growth are driven by marketing. Because of this, we are passionate about helping marketers unlock growth for their companies and seeing them thrive. We work with our customers to empower them to make more effective marketing and business decisions with insights leveraging one of the richest proprietary data sets in the world.   

Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in advancing our vision to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce by helping organizations thrive and grow through marketing excellence. LinkedIn Marketing Solutions (LMS) Customer Insights team is seeking a dynamic, visionary Principal Insights Analyst with a strong technical background and proven expertise in marketing analytics and measurement innovation to join our global team which is responsible for developing and scaling leading-edge marketing measurement and insights solutions to support our sales teams with deepening strategic relationships with our marketing customers and driving commercial outcomes powered by the experiences of LinkedIn’s 1B+ members spanning over 200 countries and territories.

Key responsibilities for this role include data solutions innovation aligned to new platform products, features and associated measurement and insights solutions using advanced analytics and technical partner solutions to deliver world-class marketing and business intelligence to unlock new paths for market differentiation and growth. Realizing the vision for this role will require developing and scaling complex customer insights and measurement solutions for enterprise customers, working in close collaboration with sales teams and cross-functional partners to enable LMS sales teams to better nurture and grow existing customers through insights and measurement innovation. The ideal candidate is highly customer-centric, consultative, and thrives in a collaborative environment with team members and cross-function partners in Marketing, Product, Data Science and Data Engineering.

Responsibilities: 

Solutions Innovation


Lead Customer Insights custom solutions delivery and innovation for large enterprise customers focusing on new data solutions design, development and implementation leveraging advanced analytics and data modeling techniques
Drive alignment, prioritization, risk assessments and issues mitigation across team deliverables to ensure delivery against SLAs, knowledge transfer and quality controls.
Advise senior Product and Engineering partners on prioritization of data table access, core tables development, bug fixes and technical enhancements, including development of on-demand scale solutions.



Team Leadership


Lead teams to consistently deliver high quality work with appropriate visibility and aligned to quality standards.
Design and implement new ways of working that increase Customer Insights impact on the business and accelerate time to value
Create a collaborative work environment by fostering knowledge sharing, constructive feedback, transparency, accountability and continuous learning
Coach and mentor team members, in best-practice of modern planning and execution -- modeling LinkedIn’s culture and values; serve as a role model for Customer Insights analysts while influencing stakeholders to think more strategically and creatively about data solutions to unlock customer growth.



Stakeholder Partnerships


Work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to lead in capturing complex business requirements, determining solution prioritization and evaluating customer needs and resourcing
Establish strong partnerships with Sales, Product, Product Marketing, Engineering and Data Science teams to advance the development and scaling of advertising insights and measurement solutions
Be a world-class collaborator who can build trust, influence and co-create effectively with a diverse group of partners across the global Customer Insights and broader LMS organizations.



Commercial Impact


Act as a trusted advisor to sales partners and customers, offering expertise on advanced measurement and insights capability areas -- including MMM, MMT, incrementality (e.g., conversion lift testing) and advanced SQL query development.
Ensure all measurement and insights innovations align with key commercial objectives, equipping sales teams with insights that support revenue expansion, relationship-building, and strategic advisory capabilities
Lead in the development of new and innovative Customer Insights scale assets (e.g., meta analyses) that demonstrate the value of new and existing platform features and ad formats, while expanding the business use cases for LinkedIn’s first-party data
Leverage marketing analytics and technical subject matter expertise to meaningfully influence and impact key business priorities and customer outcomes



Qualifications

Basic Qualifications 


10+ years of experience in digital media analytics, marketing analytics, performance marketing, media consulting or related industry
5+ years of technical data analytics project experience in customer-facing consultative roles
Experience in advanced SQL, python, data modelling, marketing analytics methodologies (e.g., including MMM, MMT, incrementality (e.g., conversion lift testing) and advanced SQL query development
Bachelors or above in a Marketing, data science, computer science, engineering, mathematics or other quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience



 Preferred Qualifications 


15+ years of experience in digital media analytics, marketing analytics, media consulting or related industry
7+ years of technical data analytics project management experience in customer-facing consultative roles
Strong analytical and adaptive problem-solving skills, with a focus on driving actionable insights from complex data sets
Strong commercial and customer success orientation, with proven track record developing insights and measurement solutions aligned to commercial outcomes
Experience with CRM platform technology and data structures, identity solutions data cleanroom technologies (e.g., Google Ads Data Hub, LiveRamp, Snowflake, InfoSum)
Expertise in advanced SQL, python, data modelling, marketing analytics methodologies (e.g., including MMM, MMT, incrementality (e.g., conversion lift testing) and advanced SQL query development
Experience with CRM, identity solutions data cleanroom technologies (e.g., Google Ads Data Hub, LiveRamp, Snowflake)
Experience with LLM and Gen-AI techniques
Excellent business judgment, strategic thinking and solutions orientation
Experience in B2B marketing analytics and marketing intelligence, or B2B consulting
Experience working directly with engineering and technical teams, as well as individual contributors
Excellent communication, presentation skills and experience presenting to executive stakeholders and influencing senior leadership
Experience working with offshore analyst teams



Suggested skills 


Digital Marketing
Performance Analytics
Data-driven Consulting
Project Management
Executive Stakeholder Management



LinkedIn is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

The pay range for this role is $148,000 to $230,000. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor.

The total compensation package for this position may also include annual performance bonus, stock, benefits and/or other applicable incentive compensation plans. For more information, visit https://careers.linkedin.com/benefits.

Additional Information

Equal Opportunity Statement

We seek candidates with a wide range of perspectives and backgrounds and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. LinkedIn considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

LinkedIn is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. Our goal is to foster an inclusive and accessible workplace where everyone has the opportunity to be successful.

If you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening, apply for a position, or participate in the interview process, connect with us at accommodations@linkedin.com and describe the specific accommodation requested for a disability-related limitation.

Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process. Examples of reasonable accommodations include but are not limited to:


Documents in alternate formats or read aloud to you
Having interviews in an accessible location
Being accompanied by a service dog
Having a sign language interpreter present for the interview



A request for an accommodation will be responded to within three business days. However, non-disability related requests, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.

LinkedIn will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by LinkedIn, or (c) consistent with LinkedIn's legal duty to furnish information.

San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, LinkedIn will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pay Transparency Policy Statement

As a federal contractor, LinkedIn follows the Pay Transparency and non-discrimination provisions described at this link: https://lnkd.in/paytransparency.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates

Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

  • Lead teams to consistently deliver high quality work with appropriate visibility and aligned to quality standards.
  • Design and implement new ways of working that increase Customer Insights impact on the business and accelerate time to value
  • Create a collaborative work environment by fostering knowledge sharing, constructive feedback, transparency, accountability and continuous learning
  • Coach and mentor team members, in best-practice of modern planning and execution -- modeling LinkedIn’s culture and values; serve as a role model for Customer Insights analysts while influencing stakeholders to think more strategically and creatively about data solutions to unlock customer growth.


Stakeholder Partnerships

  • Work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to lead in capturing complex business requirements, determining solution prioritization and evaluating customer needs and resourcing
  • Establish strong partnerships with Sales, Product, Product Marketing, Engineering and Data Science teams to advance the development and scaling of advertising insights and measurement solutions
  • Be a world-class collaborator who can build trust, influence and co-create effectively with a diverse group of partners across the global Customer Insights and broader LMS organizations.


Commercial Impact

  • Act as a trusted advisor to sales partners and customers, offering expertise on advanced measurement and insights capability areas -- including MMM, MMT, incrementality (e.g., conversion lift testing) and advanced SQL query development.
  • Ensure all measurement and insights innovations align with key commercial objectives, equipping sales teams with insights that support revenue expansion, relationship-building, and strategic advisory capabilities
  • Lead in the development of new and innovative Customer Insights scale assets (e.g., meta analyses) that demonstrate the value of new and existing platform features and ad formats, while expanding the business use cases for LinkedIn’s first-party data
  • Leverage marketing analytics and technical subject matter expertise to meaningfully influence and impact key business priorities and customer outcomes


Qualifications

Basic Qualifications 

  • 10+ years of experience in digital media analytics, marketing analytics, performance marketing, media consulting or related industry
  • 5+ years of technical data analytics project experience in customer-facing consultative roles
  • Experience in advanced SQL, python, data modelling, marketing analytics methodologies (e.g., including MMM, MMT, incrementality (e.g., conversion lift testing) and advanced SQL query development
  • Bachelors or above in a Marketing, data science, computer science, engineering, mathematics or other quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience


 Preferred Qualifications 

  • 15+ years of experience in digital media analytics, marketing analytics, media consulting or related industry
  • 7+ years of technical data analytics project management experience in customer-facing consultative roles
  • Strong analytical and adaptive problem-solving skills, with a focus on driving actionable insights from complex data sets
  • Strong commercial and customer success orientation, with proven track record developing insights and measurement solutions aligned to commercial outcomes
  • Experience with CRM platform technology and data structures, identity solutions data cleanroom technologies (e.g., Google Ads Data Hub, LiveRamp, Snowflake, InfoSum)
  • Expertise in advanced SQL, python, data modelling, marketing analytics methodologies (e.g., including MMM, MMT, incrementality (e.g., conversion lift testing) and advanced SQL query development
  • Experience with CRM, identity solutions data cleanroom technologies (e.g., Google Ads Data Hub, LiveRamp, Snowflake)
  • Experience with LLM and Gen-AI techniques
  • Excellent business judgment, strategic thinking and solutions orientation
  • Experience in B2B marketing analytics and marketing intelligence, or B2B consulting
  • Experience working directly with engineering and technical teams, as well as individual contributors
  • Excellent communication, presentation skills and experience presenting to executive stakeholders and influencing senior leadership
  • Experience working with offshore analyst teams


Suggested skills 

  • Digital Marketing
  • Performance Analytics
  • Data-driven Consulting
  • Project Management
  • Executive Stakeholder Management


LinkedIn is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

The pay range for this role is $148,000 to $230,000. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor.

The total compensation package for this position may also include annual performance bonus, stock, benefits and/or other applicable incentive compensation plans. For more information, visit https://careers.linkedin.com/benefits.

Additional Information

Equal Opportunity Statement

We seek candidates with a wide range of perspectives and backgrounds and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. LinkedIn considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

LinkedIn is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. Our goal is to foster an inclusive and accessible workplace where everyone has the opportunity to be successful.

If you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening, apply for a position, or participate in the interview process, connect with us at accommodations@linkedin.com and describe the specific accommodation requested for a disability-related limitation.

Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process. Examples of reasonable accommodations include but are not limited to:

  • Documents in alternate formats or read aloud to you
  • Having interviews in an accessible location
  • Being accompanied by a service dog
  • Having a sign language interpreter present for the interview


A request for an accommodation will be responded to within three business days. However, non-disability related requests, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.

LinkedIn will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by LinkedIn, or (c) consistent with LinkedIn's legal duty to furnish information.

San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, LinkedIn will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pay Transparency Policy Statement

As a federal contractor, LinkedIn follows the Pay Transparency and non-discrimination provisions described at this link: https://lnkd.in/paytransparency.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates

Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

Title: Data Analyst - GTM
Description:
The trucking industry is the backbone of the global economy. More than 70% of what we consume in the U.S. is moved by trucks. Those trucks are powered by over 3.5 million drivers per year and create over $700B in annual revenue. Trucking is a massive industry but it is a traditional industry and like many traditional industries, it is ripe for innovation.

CloudTrucks is building the operating system for trucking and is the first platform specifically designed to empower truck drivers. Our all-in-one, “business in a box” solution optimizes and automates operations and accelerates cash-flow for drivers, so they can focus on building their business.

The Data Analytics team at CloudTrucks owns all business reporting end-to-end, and develops both internal and customer-facing, data analytics products in collaboration with Product development teams.

As a Data Analyst supporting the Go-To-Market (GTM) teams at CloudTrucks, you’ll have the opportunity to work with multiple teams across the company, including Sales, RevOps, Marketing and Growth Engineering. You’ll own data pipelines, reporting and in-depth analyses that help these teams make day-to-day product and business decisions.

Examples of projects that you may work on


Growth Engineering Our Growth engineering team has the mission to scale our driver onboarding flow. As a data analyst, you’ll play a key role helping PMs and engineers build metrics to ensure they have adequate visibility into the onboarding flow, help them define, run and measure experiments and gather insights about future product improvements.
Marketing Our Marketing team is focused on driver acquisition. As a data analyst, you’ll have the opportunity to work closely with them to continue building and improving our Marketing Attribution models, and provide insights into the Marketing funnel and campaign performance.
RevOps Our RevOps team works closely with Sales to onboard drivers to CloudTrucks. As a data analyst, you’ll have the opportunity to help the team track and measure each step of the sales funnel and look for opportunities where processes can be improved. You’ll be able to combine sales and product data to do in-depth analysis and provide insights into funnel performance, define, build and monitor revenue impact metrics.


Responsibilities


Own end-to-end reporting from building the data pipeline to data visualization.
Build data pipelines to support both internal and customer facing products, and collaborate with Product development teams to launch and measure success.
Work cross-functionally to build KPIs, and develop complex transformative analyses that help teams improve their processes, make product and business decisions.
Communicate insights and recommendations to a broader audience, include technical and non-technical stakeholders.


What we are looking for


3+ years of experience as an analyst
Interest in Freight Industry
Experience helping GTM teams (Marketing, Sales, RevOps, Growth) make better data-driven decisions
Strong working knowledge of SQL and experience with Business Intelligence tools (Looker, Heap, Amplitude)
Experience building and maintaining Marketing Attribution Models and measuring campaign performance. Alternatively, strong working experience with MMP tools (Mobile Measuring Partner tools, like Singular, Adjust, AppFlyer)
Experience working with Ad Network data
Experience working directly with Sales and RevOps teams, with strong familiarity with sales motions and sales KPIs
Strong working experience with CRM tools like Salesforce or HubSpot
Exposure to software engineering principles - version control, code reviews, unit testing.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work cross-functionally.
Experience working alongside both technical and non-technical teams.
Ability to communicate and influence both technical and non-technical audiences.
A natural curiosity and comfort trying new things that may not have existing playbooks.
An intrinsic drive to automate menial or low value tasks.


Nice to haves


Experience with Python or R
Experience with data pipeline development tools like dbt, dataform
Experience working in Freight Operations or Logistics
Experience with Data Integration tools like Fivetran, Polytomic, Segment
Experience with Lifecycle Marketing tools like Marketo or Braze
Experience with Marketing Operations
Experience working at high-growth startups. Preference for experience in consumer tech, marketplace, or SaaS industries.


A bit about our culture

We value high autonomy, ownership, and delivering results - in short - whatever it takes to set our customers up for success. We encourage each other to push the envelope, execute quickly, and be resilient to failure. We also work occasional late nights or weekends to deliver an above-and-beyond customer experience, while respecting and celebrating each other's personal background, values and commitments. In return, we are well compensated, take pride in seeing outsized impact to our product, and have memorable experiences learning and growing alongside a truly exceptional set of peers.

Salary Range

$130,000 - $165,000

Actual compensation packages depends on various factors including geographical location and review of experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant. At CloudTrucks certain roles are eligible for benefits and additional rewards. These rewards are allocated based on individual impact in role. In addition, certain roles also have the opportunity to earn sales incentives based on revenue or utilization, depending on the terms of the plan and the employee’s role.


This role requires 4 days in office in San Francisco. Our work from home day is Friday.


About CloudTrucks

CloudTrucks is a virtual trucking carrier in the multi-billion dollar trucking space. Core to this industry are over 3.5M truck drivers. They move more than 70% of all goods transported around the U.S., yet operate in a highly fragmented industry with huge opportunities for products, services and automation. We strive to deliver solutions that help truck drivers operate with much greater efficiency, increase their revenue, and offload business complexity. We are looking for uniquely exceptional people to join us on our journey as we massively scale into an industry-defining business.

We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
