Title: Senior IT Data Engineer
Description:
Personnel Qualifications


At least seven years of experience evaluating, working in production environments with cloud data systems, including RDBMs, data warehouses, data lakes, data pipelines
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Business Administration Science, Mathematics, or Engineering.
Experience with RDBMs, NoSQL databases


Capabilities


Ability to implement and manage cloud-based data and big data systems including: Amazon Aurora, Snowflake, Databricks, Amazon Redshift.
Ability to use infrastructure as code (IaC) such as Terraform, AWS CloudFormation to build and configure data systems as part of a DevOps program.
Ability to implement and manage hybrid data systems including a mixture of cloud and onpremises data systems such as MS SQL Server.


Certifications


AWS Solutions Architect - Associate/Professional
AWS Data Engineer - Associate
AWS Developer - Associate
Show more
HTML:
Personnel Qualifications

  • At least seven years of experience evaluating, working in production environments with cloud data systems, including RDBMs, data warehouses, data lakes, data pipelines
  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Business Administration Science, Mathematics, or Engineering.
  • Experience with RDBMs, NoSQL databases

Capabilities

  • Ability to implement and manage cloud-based data and big data systems including: Amazon Aurora, Snowflake, Databricks, Amazon Redshift.
  • Ability to use infrastructure as code (IaC) such as Terraform, AWS CloudFormation to build and configure data systems as part of a DevOps program.
  • Ability to implement and manage hybrid data systems including a mixture of cloud and onpremises data systems such as MS SQL Server.

Certifications

  • AWS Solutions Architect - Associate/Professional
  • AWS Data Engineer - Associate
  • AWS Developer - Associate

Title: Medical Records/Data Entry Assistant
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Calvary Hospital. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

For over 125 years, Calvary Hospital and Calvary @Home located in the Bronx, New York has been dedicated to the palliative care of advanced cancer and other terminally ill patients and their families. Through a caring, compassionate, philosophy of non-abandonment, the hospice provides a full spectrum of palliative services, including emotional, spiritual, and physical care. The hospice receives patients from referring institutions throughout New York City and the entire tristate area. When you come to Calvary Hospital, you're not just getting a job, you're joining a family.

Benefits/Perks


Includes accrued vacation days, sick days, holidays, and free days
Pension (vested after 5 years of full-time or part-time service)
Participation in 403 (b)
Voluntary Benefits: Short Term Disability, Life Insurance, Cancer Insurance, Flex Spending, Transit Check
Free On-Site Parking


Requirements

Maintains patient medical records in Hospice. Ensures accurate and timely filing into processing patient medical assistant. Enters data into the Hospice computer system.

Hours: 9am - 5pm

Status: Per Diem

Salary: $27.94 - $29.38/ hourly

Qualifications


Minimum of one year of clerical experience in an office environment is required. One year of Medical Records experience is preferred.
Competency with computer software and peripherals is required.
Data entry experience is required. Type 30 WPM.


Education


High School Diploma required. Business School or some college preferred.


COVID-19 vaccination is strongly encouraged for all new hires prior to beginning employment at Calvary Hospital.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
¿Te imaginas participando en la transformación de las principales organizaciones nacionales e internacionales?

En Deloitte estamos comprometidos con generar un impacto en la sociedad, en nuestros clientes y en ti.

Buscamos un/a Junior Data Analyst con enfoque en Gobierno del Dato, que se incorpore a nuestro equipo formando parte de la oficina del Chief Data Officer. Esta posición combina tareas de análisis y control de calidad del dato con funciones clave en la implantación de políticas, procesos y estándares de gobierno.

Se trata de una excelente oportunidad para perfiles con base técnica sólida y gran motivación por desarrollarse en el mundo del dato, en una compañía en plena transformación hacia una cultura data-driven.

¿Cuál es el reto?


Apoyar en la definición, implementación y mantenimiento del Modelo de Gobierno del Dato:
Participar en la definición de políticas, procesos y estándares.
Contribuir a la definición y asignación de roles y responsabilidades
Apoyar a los Data Stewards y Data Owners en la ejecución de los procesos definidos por la estrategia de Gobierno del Dato
Colaborar en el mantenimiento del catálogo de datos y glosario de negocio.
Participar en proyectos de mejora de la Calidad del Dato (limpieza, enriquecimiento y mantenimiento de datos).
Colaborar con el negocio en iniciativas transversales de mejora continua en la gestión de la información:
Apoyar en la creación y mejora de dashboards en Power BI.
Realizar consultas SQL para análisis, reporting y control de calidad del dato.
Generar informes ad hoc y visualizaciones para equipos de negocio.


¿Cómo te imaginamos?


Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Estadística, Matemáticas, Física, ADE + especialización en análisis de datos, o similares. (Valorable formación complementaria en Data Governance o Data Analytics)
De 1 a 2 años de experiencia en áreas relacionadas a datos, análisis o gestión de información (Exposición con modelos de gobierno del dato, catálogo de datos e iniciativas de calidad del dato).
Nivel básico-intermedio en herramientas de BI. Fundamentos de modelos de datos, procesos ETL y almacenamiento. Conocimientos básicos de SQL, Excel, y herramientas de análisis o gestión de datos.
Nivel alto de inglés


Conocimientos deseables:


Familiaridad con herramientas de calidad del dato (Microsoft Data Quality Services o similar) y con herramientas de gobierno del dato (Azure Purview o similar)
Conocimiento general de privacidad y seguridad de datos (GDPR, LOPD).


Perfil personal:


Curiosidad por el dato, con ganas de aprender y evolucionar en el ámbito del gobierno del dato.
Mentalidad analítica, orientada al detalle y con buena capacidad de organización.
Proactividad, autonomía y actitud colaborativa con equipos técnicos y de negocio.
Capacidad para identificar mejoras, oportunidades y aportar soluciones innovadoras.


¿Cómo es trabajar en Deloitte?

🤩 Proyectos de alto impacto donde tendrás un largo recorrido y aprendizaje

☯️ Un día a día híbrido-flexible: tendrás horario flexible y un buen equilibrio entre el teletrabajo y el trabajo en equipo en nuestras oficinas o las de nuestros clientes

⚽ Buen ambiente dentro y fuera de la oficina: disfrutarás de varios teambuildings al año, actividades culturales y deportivas… ¡y mucho más!

🧘‍♀️ Bienestar integral: cuídate con nuestro programa de salud física, mental y financiera… ¡y con equipo médico en las oficinas!

🤲 Impacto social: Podrás apuntarte a una gran cantidad de voluntariados de alcance nacional e internacional y a proyectos pro-bono con los que poner tu tiempo y talento al servicio de quienes más lo necesitan

🗣️ Cultura del feedback y aprendizaje continuo: crecerás en un entorno inclusivo donde la igualdad de oportunidades y tu plan personalizado de formación impulsarán tu desarrollo. ¿Ya te visualizas en la Deloitte University de París?

🤝 Beneficios exclusivos por ser parte de Deloitte: podrás disfrutar de un gran catálogo de beneficios y de un completo plan de retribución flexible

Si te gusta lo que lees, estos son tus próximos pasos:


Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil
Si encajas en el puesto, nuestro equipo de talento te contactará para conocerte mejor


¡Comienza el proceso! Te iremos guiando por las diferentes fases hasta tu incorporación.
Show more

  • Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
¿Te defines por tu talento y tu visión?

Entonces, tú también puedes marcar la diferencia. Únete a un entorno profesional que contribuye a la transformación de empresas y sociedad. Alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites y únete a una firma que va más allá de los servicios profesionales.

Porque marcar la diferencia no es solo algo que decimos. Es lo que hacemos.

Desarrolla tu carrera con nosotros.




En KPMG K-TIA D&A (Tecnología e Innovación en Auditoría) contamos con un equipo excepcional, una amplia gama de servicios y de recursos tecnológicos adecuados, una potente red global y una clara estrategia para llegar al mercado. Por ello, nuestro equipo de D&A para auditoría se encuentra en un proceso de expansión y captación de talento.

Actualmente, nos encontramos buscando un/a analista de datos junior para ampliar el equipo.




¿Qué podrás hacer?

Realizar pruebas de D&A en los trabajos de auditoría, siendo capaz de entregar un resultado de calidad y ajustado a los tiempos de ejecución esperados.
Desarrollo de soluciones en PowerBI en base a necesidades.




¿Qué necesitas saber?

Titulación: Grado en ADE (valorable especialización en D&A) o Ingeniería Industrial
Conocimientos técnicos necesario: Excel avanzado, SQL básico, PowerBI avanzado.
Experiencia máxima de un año en análisis de datos contables
Nivel de inglés: medio

Valorable:

Experiencia en puesto similar, autonomía, capacidad para identificar necesidades y generar soluciones adecuadas




¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?

Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficina
Oportunidades internacionales y red de contactos global
Formación continua y plan de carrera a tu medida
Salario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible
31 días laborables de vacaciones
La tarde de tu cumpleaños libre
Flexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajo
Acceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones
Los beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas

Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento.

Show more

¿Qué necesitas saber?

  • Titulación: Grado en ADE (valorable especialización en D&A) o Ingeniería Industrial
  • Conocimientos técnicos necesario: Excel avanzado, SQL básico, PowerBI avanzado.
  • Experiencia máxima de un año en análisis de datos contables
  • Nivel de inglés: medio

Valorable:

  • Experiencia en puesto similar, autonomía, capacidad para identificar necesidades y generar soluciones adecuadas


¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?

  • Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficina
  • Oportunidades internacionales y red de contactos global
  • Formación continua y plan de carrera a tu medida
  • Salario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible
  • 31 días laborables de vacaciones
  • La tarde de tu cumpleaños libre
  • Flexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajo
  • Acceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones
  • Los beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas

Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Happy Mammoth:

Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women’s health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:


This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)


At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:


A strong salary package
A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
Flexible working hours
Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
Opportunities for professional growth and development


Job Summary:

As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you’ll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you’ll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling


Qualifications:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly


What will set you apart:


You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You’re able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You’re able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business


CVs should be in English

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
ABOUT NUMA

Hey there! We’re Numa, a forward-thinking hospitality brand redefining how people discover cities. We create spaces where simplicity meets innovation, offering thoughtfully designed rooms, studios, and apartments in the heart of Europe’s most vibrant neighbourhoods.
We’re not just transforming the guest experience—we’re revolutionizing the hospitality industry from the inside out. Our cutting-edge technology streamlines operations, delivering unparalleled value with no hidden fees—just real, quality experiences.
At Numa, we believe that travel should be curious and authentic, and we bring those same values to our work culture. As part of our team, you’ll experience a dynamic and supportive environment where creativity thrives, and your contributions make a real impact. We’re committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace where every voice is valued, and different perspectives fuel our innovation.

ABOUT YOU

Conduct Deep-Dive Analysis: You will perform advanced analysis on guest feedback and operational data, using your statistical knowledge to uncover root causes, identify significant trends (forecasting), and build compelling business cases for what to improve next.
Build & Deploy: You will work with the team to translate your data-driven insights into tangible solutions by designing, building, and deploying robust workflows using Python.
Provide Data Partnership: Act as a key data partner for the Guest Experience & Operations teams, supporting them with ad-hoc data extractions, analysis, and generating insights to answer critical business questions as they arise.
Measure and Iterate: You will manage the full lifecycle of your projects, from initial analysis to deploying an automation and, finally, to measuring its impact on our key metrics and ROI. 
Stakeholders Enablement: Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)

ABOUT THE ROLE

Analytical Experience: 2-4 years in a data analytics or similar role.
Technical Proficiency in Analytics
Strong proficiency in SQL for complex data querying and manipulation. 
Prior experience in a startup or tech-driven environment is mandatory.
Hands-on experience with a modern BI tool (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) to build strategic and user-friendly dashboards.
A solid understanding of foundational statistical principles and how to apply them to real-world business problems.
Business Acumen: You are passionate about understanding the "why" behind the data and can clearly communicate your findings and their strategic implications to both technical and non-technical audiences
An Automation Mindset (and a Willingness to Learn)
You are naturally drawn to efficiency and are excited by the idea of process improvement. While deep programming experience isn't required, a strong desire to learn and hands-on experience with Python or low-code tools (like n8n, Zapier, etc.) is a significant plus.
Technical Foundations: Experience working with data warehouses like
BigQuery or Postgres is a plus.
Mindset: A true problem-solver with a data-first mentality. You are driven by the continuous cycle of analysis, implementation, and measurement to achieve a tangible business outcome.
ABOUT OUR OFFER
Empower your career: Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where your ideas help shape our future. Enjoy opportunities for professional growth and build a fulfilling career path.
Experience our brand: Immerse yourself in the Numa lifestyle with a complimentary stay. Share the love with friends and family through exclusive discounts on our stylish apartments. Connect with a global community of colleagues at our inspiring team-building events.

Numa values the diversity of the people it hires and serves. Diversity at our company means fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognised, appreciated, respected and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilise each person’s talents and strengths. We therefore welcome applications from people of all races, ethnicities, disability statuses, ages, religions, gender identities, and sexual orientations.

For more information on the processing of your personal data, please see our Privacy Notice.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
ENABLING AREAS - GROWTH

Junior Data Analyst




Our Story

Deloitte drives progress. Using our vast range of expertise, that covers audit, risk advisory, and consulting services across tax, business, technology and corporate finance, we help our clients become leaders wherever they choose to compete. To do this, we invest in outstanding people. We build teams of future thinkers, with diverse talents and backgrounds, and empower them all to reach for and achieve more.




How you will Make an Impact

Our Growth team is looking for a JuniorData Analyst to help support client engagement and business development efforts across the firm. This is a great opportunity to join a collaborative, fast-paced team and gain hands-on experience working with data in a business environment.




About the Role:

Within this role, you’ll play a key part in ensuring data is accurately entered, maintained, and organized to support our client-facing teams and growth initiatives. You will champion our CRM system, working closely with the CRM lead to ensure it is effectively supporting the wider firm. You will be responsible for managing, analysing, and optimizing customer data within the organization’s CRM system. Your efforts will help optimise customer engagement and help inform growth strategies and streamline internal processes. This is an ideal position for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and interested in starting a career in data or business operations.




Key Responsibilities:

Provide day-to-day support for our CRM system, ensuring data quality and system reliability.
Respond to ad-hoc data and system requests from internal stakeholders.
Collaborate with other teams to define CRM data requirements and deliver actionable analysis.
Create and maintain client accounts and records in the CRM.
Monitor the sales pipeline and assist with monthly reporting to partners.
Work with teams across the firm to enhance the customer journey and identify data-driven growth opportunities.
Continuously explore system functionality and champion best practices across teams.
Develop dashboards and reports that provide insights on customer behavior, sales performance, and campaign effectiveness.
Maintain and enhance data quality within the CRM through regular cleansing, validation, and governance processes.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to enhance customer experience and business performance.
Support campaign execution by helping in engagement analysis and performance metrics.
Create & maintain dashboards/reports to track campaign performance and customer KPIs.




Let’s Talk About You

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Business, Econometrics, Data Analytics or a quantitative field.
Familiarity with CRM platforms e.g., Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics will be considered an asset.
Strong analytical skills and experience with tools like Excel, SQL or BI tools.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and figure things out with minimal direction.
A proactive mindset, with a willingness to ask questions, challenge assumptions, and suggest improvements.
Ability to translate data into clear insights and actionable recommendations.
Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented attitude.
Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
Proactively looks for opportunities and can put forward effective and relevant business solutions.
Excellent attention to detail, with a focus on data accuracy and consistency.
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, working effectively across departments.




Why Deloitte?




As a Purpose-led organization, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles that distinguish the Deloitte culture. We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energies you. We tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

Premium membership for corporate discounts in restaurants, retail, gyms and more.
Health Insurance cover for yourself and dependents.
Mental health support through sponsored therapy sessions.
Hybrid working option.
Digital learning, mentoring and regular performance snapshots.
Coaching and support designed to refresh your knowledge and skills.
Renowned training programme with Deloitte University.




A career at Deloitte is an opportunity to develop in any direction you choose. Join us and you’ll experience a purpose you can believe in and an impact you can see. You’ll be free to bring your true self to work every day. And you’ll never stop growing, whatever your level.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Información clave:

Equipo: D. Performance, Inteligencia de Negocio y Modelo Operativo

Localización: Madrid, España

Nivel de experiencia: +5 años

Tipo de trabajo: híbrido

Requisitos: inglés B2 o superior + Licenciatura o superior

El equipo al que te unes:

La vacante está dentro la D. Performance, Inteligencia de Negocio y Modelo Operativo de la D.E. Movilidad Iberia.

En la Dirección Ejecutiva de Movilidad Iberia, somos responsables de la gestión y desarrollo de estrategias para la movilidad en la región ibérica. Este puesto jugará un papel vital en apoyar a la Dirección de Movilidad Iberia en su misión de optimizar la gestión y estrategia de movilidad, asegurando que las decisiones se basen en datos precisos y análisis profundos.

Principales tareas:


Serás responsable de interpretar datos y aplicar métodos estadísticos para resolver problemas de negocio complejos.
Construirás modelos analíticos utilizando plataformas de análisis de datos para apoyar la toma de decisiones.
Utilizarás tus conocimientos para automatizar tareas y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos.
Colaborarás estrechamente con diferentes áreas de la empresa para alinear el análisis de datos con los objetivos estratégicos.
Manejarás plataformas de Business Intelligence para la visualización de datos y generación de insights.
Asegurarás la calidad y el correcto manejo de los datos dentro de la organización, manteniendo altos estándares de seguridad del dato.



Qué ofrecemos:


Contrato indefinido
Bonus según objetivos
Seguro médico
Aportación a plan de pensiones
Desconexión digital
Medidas de conciliación
Asesoría legal
Servicios de apoyo al empleado



Encajarás en el puesto si:


Tienes estudios en áreas relacionadas con la ciencia de datos, estadística, matemáticas, informática, ingeniería o econometría.
Experiencia demostrable en análisis de datos y visualización.
Conocimientos avanzados en plataformas de Business Intelligence y herramientas de análisis estadístico. Se valorará positivamente experiencia en PowerBI y DAX.
Experiencia de trabajo en la nube. Se valorará positivamente experiencia en el ecosistema Azure.
Fuerte comprensión de los procesos de negocio y capacidad para traducir necesidades empresariales en requerimientos analíticos.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación para compartir hallazgos con audiencias técnicas y no técnicas.
Capacidad de resolver problemas de negocio con analítica de datos.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

WHAT YOU’LL DO

Join the Global Merchandising team within Sales and play a key role in the In & Post Season Value Stream. You’ll work with advanced AI technologies and leverage SQL, programming tools, and data modelling best practices to deliver actionable insights and optimize product performance.


Support in-season inventory planning, stock management, and end-of-season sale pricing using AI-powered pricing engines (Mark Down Online and Mark Down Retail).
Translate large volumes of data into actionable insights that guide strategic decisions across fashion retail and e-commerce.
Define, monitor, and visualize key KPIs and OKRs to drive transparency and measure success.
Lead data modelling conversations to ensure optimal data structures and model performance within your product area.
Act as the go-to analytics expert within your product team, collaborating end-to-end on data-driven product development and business case validation.



Please note that this is a temporary position for :1 year, starting as soon as possible.

Who You’ll Work With

You’ll be part of a truly international and cross-functional team, working closely with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Business Experts, and Product Managers to bring cutting-edge AI products to life. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do; our team brings together diverse backgrounds and perspectives to solve complex challenges and create real value for millions of customers across global markets. We work in an agile setup that encourages experimentation, continuous learning, and open dialogue. If you're someone who thrives in a fast-paced, curious, and supportive environment, you'll feel right at home here.

Who You Are

We are looking for people with…


A degree in Economics, Business, Supply Chain, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in analytics roles within retail, fashion, or tech-driven companies, ideally linked to product or business development.
Proficient in SQL, Python, or R, with experience using modern data tools such as Git and dbt for managing data transformation workflows.
A solid understanding of statistical and analytical methods applied to real-world data problems.
Experience using data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Looker).



And people who are…


Strategic thinkers with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for solving complex problems.
Clear communicators who can transform data into compelling stories and practical recommendations.
Team players who thrive in collaborative, agile environments and are comfortable working with a range of stakeholders.



Who We Are

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE 

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.


We offer all our employee’s attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here. 
30 days holiday
We offer a collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance  
H&M Incentive Program  
Wellness benefit 3000kr/year  
Benify Benefits Portal  
Community with activities 



JOIN US

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.


We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

 WHAT YOU’LL DO

Join the Global Merchandising team within Sales and play a key role in the In & Post Season Value Stream. You’ll work with advanced AI technologies and leverage SQL, programming tools, and data modelling best practices to deliver actionable insights and optimize product performance.

  • Support in-season inventory planning, stock management, and end-of-season sale pricing using AI-powered pricing engines (Mark Down Online and Mark Down Retail).
  • Translate large volumes of data into actionable insights that guide strategic decisions across fashion retail and e-commerce.
  • Define, monitor, and visualize key KPIs and OKRs to drive transparency and measure success.
  • Lead data modelling conversations to ensure optimal data structures and model performance within your product area.
  • Act as the go-to analytics expert within your product team, collaborating end-to-end on data-driven product development and business case validation.


Please note that this is a temporary position for :1 year, starting as soon as possible.

Who You’ll Work With

You’ll be part of a truly international and cross-functional team, working closely with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Business Experts, and Product Managers to bring cutting-edge AI products to life. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do; our team brings together diverse backgrounds and perspectives to solve complex challenges and create real value for millions of customers across global markets. We work in an agile setup that encourages experimentation, continuous learning, and open dialogue. If you're someone who thrives in a fast-paced, curious, and supportive environment, you'll feel right at home here.

Who You Are

We are looking for people with…

  • A degree in Economics, Business, Supply Chain, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience in analytics roles within retail, fashion, or tech-driven companies, ideally linked to product or business development.
  • Proficient in SQL, Python, or R, with experience using modern data tools such as Git and dbt for managing data transformation workflows.
  • A solid understanding of statistical and analytical methods applied to real-world data problems.
  • Experience using data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Looker).


And people who are…

  • Strategic thinkers with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for solving complex problems.
  • Clear communicators who can transform data into compelling stories and practical recommendations.
  • Team players who thrive in collaborative, agile environments and are comfortable working with a range of stakeholders.


Who We Are

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE 

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.

  • We offer all our employee’s attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here. 
  • 30 days holiday
  • We offer a collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance  
  • H&M Incentive Program  
  • Wellness benefit 3000kr/year  
  • Benify Benefits Portal  
  • Community with activities 


JOIN US

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
PERCHE’ SCEGLIERE HERMES




Lavoro Agile: assenza di sistemi di timbratura, piena fiducia, si lavora per obiettivi
Talent Lab: piani di crescita e formazione per sviluppare e rafforzare le competenze tecniche
HUB55: spazio di coworking a Firenze dove condividere progetti, idee e coltivare relazioni
Welfare aziendale: attività e bonus annuali dedicati ai nostri talenti




Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Data Analyst con almeno 2 anni di esperienza nel ruolo e conoscenza avanzata di Excel. Cerchiamo una persona proattiva, motivata, che abbia una solida esperienza su Excel e sia in grado di gestire metriche complesse, oltre a gestire flussi di lavoro e documentazione digitale.




Responsabilità

Condurre analisi dettagliate dei flussi di dati esistenti, identificando inefficienze e sviluppando soluzioni per ottimizzarli.
Collaborare strettamente con i team di ingegneria e operazioni per implementare miglioramenti nei processi di gestione dei dati.
Gestire e utilizzare SharePoint per l’organizzazione e condivisione efficace di documenti e informazioni.
Gestire flussi di lavoro (workflow) tramite PowerApps per automatizzare processi aziendali.
Utilizzare Rally per pianificare, monitorare e reportare sul progresso dei progetti di ottimizzazione, garantendo l’allineamento con gli obiettivi strategici aziendali.
Creare dashboard e report per il monitoraggio delle performance operative, contribuendo così a migliorare l’efficienza.




Competenze tecniche richieste

Ottima conoscenza di Microsoft Excel a livello avanzato, con esperienza nell’analisi e gestione di metriche.
Conoscenza base di PowerApps e capacità di gestione di workflow su questa piattaforma.
Capacità di gestione e utilizzo di SharePoint.
Conoscenza base di SQL.
Capacità di Data flow mapping.
Utilizzo di Rally per il project tracking.




Competenze trasversali




Precisione
Mentalità Logico-Analitica
Ottime capacità comunicative
Ottime capacità organizzative
Ottime capacità di problem solving
Attitudine al lavoro in team







Competenze aggiuntive richieste




Conoscenza della lingua inglese (almeno B2)







Modalità di lavoro




Full time dal lunedì al venerdì
Full remote







In Hermes crediamo nelle pari opportunità e promuoviamo i principi di inclusione e diversità. Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente.

Se hai una grande passione per l'innovazione digitale e ti piace lavorare in un'ambiente giovane e dinamico, sei la persona giusta per diventare Messaggero della Tecnologia!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (.)
Description:
En BETWEEN te ofrecemos las oportunidades que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales. Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en IT e Ingeniería ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Firmware, Software, BI, Diseño, Project Management y muchas más. Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros BETWEEN Labs.

Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst para ampliar uno de nuestros equipos en el área de analítica promocional en importante empresa del sector Retail en Madrid.

Funciones

Como Data Analyst, Serás Una Parte Esencial De Nuestro Equipo, Donde Tendrás La Responsabilidad De Realizar Análisis Oportunos y Accionables Para La Toma De Decisiones,, Generando Modelos Analíticos, Técnicas De Estadística Descriptiva y Utilizando Herramientas De Análisis De Datos y Visualización. Algunas De Tus Funciones Incluirán


Realizar análisis de ventas, utilizando herramientas como SQL(Snowflake) y Python para transformar y analizar grandes volúmenes de datos.
Uso de técnicas de estadística descriptiva y series temporales
Extraer, transformar y analizar datos en SQL
Traducir datos complejos en conclusiones claras y accionables
Identificar necesidades y requisitos colaborando con los distintos equipos de negocio (Compras, MKT, …)
Análisis del desempeño de promociones y campañas comerciales mediante seguimiento y evaluación de KPIs
Creación de informes/reportes para distintas áreas de negocio en PowerBI y MicroStrategy
Preparación de presentaciones ejecutivas con conclusiones claras y recomendaciones


Beneficios

En BETWEEN Creemos En Cuidar De Nuestros Empleados y Ofrecer Un Entorno Que Fomente Su Desarrollo Profesional. Por Ello, Te Ofrecemos


Seguro médico con Sanitas para garantizar tu bienestar y el de tu familia.
Oportunidades de formación en idiomas, certificaciones, bootcamps y mucho más, para ayudarte a continuar creciendo en tus áreas de interés.
Participación en una variedad de eventos sociales y de team building como BETWEEN Night, Torneo de Padel, Black Mamba Race, entre otros, que fomentan la cohesión y el trabajo en equipo.
Retribución flexible que incluye beneficios como comedores, transporte y guarderías, para que puedas organizar tu salario de la manera que mejor te convenga.
Incentivos por validar o recomendar talento, reconociendo así la importancia de contar con un equipo diverso y capacitado.


Requisitos


Formación: Grado en Matemáticas, Física o Ingeniería
Conocimientos en estadística descriptiva y series temporales
Tecnologías requeridas: SQL (snowflake), Python, Excel, PowerBI, Azure Synapse.
Tecnologías deseables: PySpark, Snowpark, MicroStrategy
Muy valorable experiencia en sector Retail o proyectos de analítica promocional y análisis de ventas.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Happy Mammoth:

Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women’s health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:


This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)


At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:


A strong salary package
A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
Flexible working hours
Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
Opportunities for professional growth and development


Job Summary:

As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you’ll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you’ll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling


Qualifications:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly


What will set you apart:


You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You’re able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You’re able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business


CVs should be in English

Powered by JazzHR

Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling


Qualifications:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly


What will set you apart:


You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You’re able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You’re able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business


CVs should be in English

About Happy Mammoth:

Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women’s health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:

  • This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
  • The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)

At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:

  • A strong salary package
  • A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
  • A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
  • The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
  • Flexible working hours
  • Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development

Job Summary:

As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you’ll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you’ll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
  • Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
  • Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
  • Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
  • Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
  • Proficiency in SQL and Excel
  • Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
  • Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly

What will set you apart:

  • You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life

  • You’re able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
  • You’re able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Responsibilities - Your Mission

Your mission will be to contribute to the most important aircraft program in our company! The Single Aisle program is currently going through a production ramp-up and is not only the heart of AIRBUS, but also a door for infinite professional opportunities! Your journey starts with us in a data-driven organization and step by step you will be able to shape your future enjoying the benefits of a European and multinational company.

The main tasks and responsibilities will include:


Collaborate transnationally with teams along the Central Programme PM Office and ensure end to end solutions.
Consulting for different customers on digital development and improvement projects (including the understanding, challenging and translation of the customer into clear user stories)
Consolidating data from Skywise, analyzing, visualizing and interpreting them in order to provide specific deliverables (e.g. KPIs, Dashboards, Performance Analysis, Business Recommendations, Reports, etc...)
Supporting Project Leaders, Portfolio Leaders and PMBPs in their accountability to achieve time, cost, quality and performance objectives
Support initiative to improve data quality, continuity and consistency.
Manage central team data sets, data products, data ontology and analytics folder
Support ongoing developments and digital tool in operation
Establish connection between the Data Analytics and the Single Aisle Performance Management system to allow activity prioritization according to the top management requirements


Requirements - Our Ideal Candidate Will Have


Bachelor or Master degree
Negotiation level in English
Good knowledge in Airbus Analytics Platforms (e.g. Skywise including Contour, Slate and Code Repository)
Programming skills in Python/Pyspark or equivalent
Experience with PM tool like JIRA and Qlik Sense
Excellent G Suite skills
Experience with data management
Experience with stakeholder management, change management and a customer oriented mindset
Understanding of Performance Management, Project Management (e.g. Waterfall and Agile methodology) and planning tools (e.g. Planisware, MS Project, etc..)
Structured way of working with resilience and proactiveness
Ability to simplify the business and communicate easily
Flexibility and a team player with innovative thinking
Self-motivated with the ability to anticipate challenges and hands-on approach to elaborate solutions.


This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Airbus Portugal SA

Employment Type:

Permanent

Experience Level:

Professional

Job Family:

Digital

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Kiteris es una empresa joven y ágil dedicada a brindar servicios de gestión de servicios y proyectos TI de integración de software, basados en la entrega de excelencia, la calidad de nuestro equipo y la aportación de valor a través de la especialización y la innovación. Estamos ubicados en España y Portugal, pero trabajamos para diferentes clientes en Europa y LATAM.




En Kiteris Data, el grupo de Business Intelligence de Kiteris Solutions, estamos buscando un perfil de Data Analyst.




Nuestro objetivo es comprender los retos del negocio de nuestros clientes y crear aplicaciones analíticas sólidas y escalables para ayudarlos a mejorar su proceso de análisis y toma de decisiones.




Te unirás a nuestro creciente equipo de analistas y desarrolladores para dar soporte al responsable de la unidad de Negocio, aprendiendo las claves de los procesos de toma de requerimientos, análisis y diseño de nuevas aplicaciones analíticas o del evolutivo de aplicaciones existentes.




También aprenderás las principales técnicas de visualización de datos usando las herramientas más comunes en el sector de Business Intelligence y las mejores prácticas para presentar entregables de calidad a los clientes.




Lo que harás en tu día a día:

Toma de requerimientos funcionales y técnicos.
Diseño y elaboración de Dashboards analíticos (principalmente con la herramienta PowerBI).
Definición del modelo de datos juntamente con el Data Engineer.
Desarrollo de las métricas y parametrización de los objetos visuales.
Documentación de los informes desarrollados.
Responsabilización de las incidencias y evolutivos relacionados con el proyecto después de su publicación.
Según los conocimientos y experiencia del perfil, también podrá participar en la implementación de procesos ETL.




Qué buscamos en ti:

Experiencia en una posición similar más de 5 años.
Conocimiento avanzado de la herramienta de PowerBI.
Experiencia en proyectos de adopción tecnológica y acompañamiento a los usuarios en el análisis.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos de visualización de datos.
Atracción por la resolución de problemas del negocio del cliente.
Capacidad analítica y de trabajo en equipo.
Capacidad para trabajar en un ambiente de trabajo dinámico.
Valorable experiencia en el entorno de Azure y conocimiento en bases de datos SQL.
Idiomas: excelente español (requerido) y buen dominio del inglés hablado y escrito (valorado).




Lo que te ofrecemos:

Trabajo híbrido, asistiendo presencialmente 2 días por semana a las oficinas del cliente ubicadas en Viladecans.
Contrato indefinido.
Clases de inglés gratuitas.
Seguro médico privado cofinanciado.
Retribución flexible: ticket restaurante, transporte, guardería y seguro médico privado.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Revisión salarial continuada.
La posibilidad de aprender y analizar diferentes modelos de negocio (Empresas de servicios IT, comercialización eléctrica, empresas de consumo, empresas del sector agrícola, empresas del sector industrial...).
Incorporación inmediata y continuidad dentro de la empresa.

Title: Junior - Data Analyst - Milano/Cagliari
Description:
Junior - Data Analyst Milano/Cagliari

Sei pronto a #MakeAnImpactThatMatters nel nostro team Audit & Assurance?

Entrando nel Team di Deloitte Data Analytics Audit&Assurance avrai l’occasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

Con la supervisione dei colleghi e colleghe più esperti, sarai responsabile delle attività progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualità del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorità, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.

Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realtà leader nel settore.

#YourRole

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilità di imparare dai colleghi più Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.

In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Di


Raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati provenienti da diverse fonti, mediante l’utilizzo di strumenti quali Excel, SQL, Python.
Sviluppare report e dashboard tramite i principali tool di BI (es. PowerBI, Qlik Sense, Qlik Cloud,…).
Supportare nell’organizzazione e gestione dei dataset su database relazionali e NoSQL.
Analizzare, interpretare dati e fornire insights per il miglioramento dei processi aziendali


Grazie all’ufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attività di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.

#WinningRequirements


Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science
Competenze di base in analisi dei dati, statistiche e metodologie di data mining
Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati come Excel, SQL
Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione per l'analisi dei dati (es. Python, R)
Spiccate capacità analitiche e attitudine al problem-solving
Propensione al lavoro in team
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Disponibilità a viaggiare in Italia e all’estero


#NiceToHave


Esperienza su strumenti quali SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, PowerPlatform
Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di machine learning, deep learning e NLP
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di librerie di machine learning come Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.


#LoveWorkingAtDeloitteIf


Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola d’ordine è: crescita
L’idea di trasformare un problema in opportunità ti stimola
Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale d’insieme, tenendo sempre a mente l’operatività per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integrità e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le priorità possono cambiare quotidianamente
Ami lavorare in team


Si offre inserimento in stage di 6 mesi caratterizzato da un percorso di training ad alto valore formativo.

Sedi di lavoro: Milano o Cagliari

Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva

#MakeanImpactThatMatters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Strategy, Risk & Transaction Advisory, Tax & Legal e Technology & Transformation. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Se vuoi scoprire come sarà il processo di selezione, guarda questo video.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

The Data Strategy and Solution (DSS) team owns the research, creation, and maintenance of all 27,000+ distinct Label Insight attributes. This team is composed of industry experts including dietitians, food scientists, chemists, regulatory and product formulation experts. The Global Data Governance team within DSS is responsible for the quality and maintenance of our proprietary taxonomies: claims, certifications, ingredients, nutrients, and categories that are the foundation of all Label Insight data. The Global Data Governance Analyst is detail-oriented, able to make fast, but thoughtful decisions around NIQ and Label Insight data, regulations, and trends in the FMCG and grocery industries. You will receive on-the-job training for creating and managing Label Insight data taxonomies which will enable various LI-powered solutions within NIQ. Your willingness to use new NIQ platforms, learn new skills like data review, analysis, and coding will help build and maintain our data quality and, ultimately, enable customer health, trust, and new growth opportunities

Job Description


Manage the processing of globally sourced, English language data that powers attribution for various solutions. This includes on-package marketing text, ingredients, and nutrient data
Interpret, analyze, and clearly communicate our data and taxonomy structure
Audit, improve and develop internal database taxonomies
Expand our database to align with growing market trends and global expansion projects
Learn simple coding language to build and maintain LI attribute-powered solutions
Work with customer success teams to investigate and resolve customer inquirie


Qualifications


University degree, bachelor's degree or equivalent
Native speaker or high proficiency in the English language - both orally and in writing. Comfortable understand different accents
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint)
Comfortable learning new technology platforms (Coding, BI tools, GitHub, etc.)
Detail-oriented with the desire and ability to pick up new skills quickly
Comfortable with tedious and repetitive tasks
Self-motivated and able to manage deadlines and time on projects independently
Experience in data quality management, data review, or data cleaning is preferred
Technical mastery of:
BI and data querying tools and languages including: Looker, Power BI, Solr, SQL, and ElasticSearch
Internal NIQ tools and databases including: Label Insight NPE, Label Insight Explore 4.0, BB Product Library, and NIQ Discover
Internal Label Insight data management portals including: Digi, Taxonomy Management & Creation Portals, AMP, and others


Additional Information

this role is Hybrid 2 per week at the office in Sofia

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. The Data Strategy and Solution (DSS) team owns the research, creation, and maintenance of all 27,000+ distinct Label Insight attributes. This team is composed of industry experts including dietitians, food scientists, chemists, regulatory and product formulation experts. The Global Data Governance team within DSS is responsible for the quality and maintenance of our proprietary taxonomies: claims, certifications, ingredients, nutrients, and categories that are the foundation of all Label Insight data. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job title: Data Analyst

Location: Budapest – Sanofi Business Services, Váci Greens

Hybrid working

About The Job

Reporting directly to the Sapphire Product Owner, as a Sapphire Data Analyst you will be responsible for managing and analyzing data within the commercial vaccines data and analytics space.

This role involves ensuring data integrity, developing analytic & report ready datasets, and providing insights to support business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, analytics, and business intelligence.

Main Responsibilities

Reporting directly to the Sapphire Product Owner, the Data Analyst will manage business, data and organizational needs.


Leverage data and facts to identify patterns, using judgment to form conclusions that may challenge conventional wisdom, and focusing on the issues to identify high leverage intervention points and strategies
Identify and analyze business needs that support the Product strategy, harmonizing across business areas for a harmonized commercial data foundation US Vaccines. Communicate solution tradeoffs to frame and influence project decisions
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decisions.
Design and define ingestion processes to ensure efficient data flow and integration.
Strong focus on data quality assessments, implement measures to improve data accuracy and reliability.
Ability to create detailed functional specs and test cases based off business requirements.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts including design patterns and load strategies.
Proactively monitor industry, functional, and technology trends.
Identify new opportunities to leverage data and to integrate data or applications to enhance business value. Including, identifying and aggregate data from internal and external sources.
Deliver in compliance with quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements.


About You


Bachelor’s degree in data science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Expert in Data manipulation techniques (esp. querying tables with SQL)
Experience in a commercial pharmaceuticals/biotech/healthcare company is a strong plus
Knowledge of Six Sigma and Agile practices a plus
Must be a team player with the ability to collaborate in a fast-moving environment
Preferred Knowledge of Data Warehousing, Snowflake, SQL, ETL/ELT, Informatica, AWS, Power BI
Tools: JIRA, Confluence, Microsoft Suite, including Teams
Knowledge of data such as SAP, DDD, CDC, Veeva CRM data is highly preferred.


Why choose us?


An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team
Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
An environment based on last technologies and frequent training to reinforce your profile
Work from an "Office of the Year 2024" finalist office


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Discover our Code of Conduct, that serves as the moral compass that guides us when chasing the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. Please ensure to have read this document, before applying.

Title: (Junior) Data Analysis Specialist
Description:
Job Description

Global Service Center Media Measurement (GSC MM) is an operations department located in Sofia – a global centralized Hub working closely with all Media Measurement local and global teams, including Technology and Commercial. The department provides wide range of services, including data and systems quality control, panel helpdesk, data processing and delivery, data analytics, data science and automation.

We are looking for a (Junior) Analysis Specialist to join our Analysis Team in Sofia. The team supports global media operations by turning data into insights that drive decision-making. You will dive into big data, uncover valuable trends, and work with data analytical tools in a collaborative team environment to achieve your tasks. If you are curious, detail-oriented, and ready to grow your analytical skills in a dynamic environment, we would love to hear from you.

Key Activities


Analyze data for various products and studies, from standard reports to custom requests
Handle large datasets from multiple sources
Prepare data for marketing analysis and report on key metrics
Use tools like SQL, R or Python to work with data
Collaborate with team members to understand project goals, data and client needs
Help improve processes and find more effective solutions for the team and the clients


Required Skills And Knowledge


Strong ability to analyze data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights
Work or hands-on experience with SQL scripting
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools (e.g. MS Excel, Power BI)
Excellent level of English language, both written and spoken
High level of accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to identify problems and find solutions
Ability to work and collaborate in an international team environment
Knowledge in Python or R is considered as an advantage


We offer:


Food vouchers of 120 BGN monthly
Life Insurance
Additional Medical Insurance, incl Prophylactics, Outpatient care, Inpatient care, Expenses for medications and medical products
Additional paid leave of 3 days in case of no overdue leave days from previous year
Free access to LinkedIn Learning platform


In addition:


A Hybrid model of working: part of the week you work from home (home office), a part from the office
Working in an international organization, once you become a specialist in your field, you can count on numerous programs offering development or relocation to other departments or countries. Your development is important to us!
Stable employment in a dynamic and international environment with an established position on the market
The opportunity to gain a valuable experience and knowledge of FMCG on the country and international level
Friendly working environment


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. Title: Junior Market Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We show the world what people want.

Join GfK and help us shape tomorrow. As an NIQ company, we are the world's leading consumer intelligence firm, delivering the Full View™ on consumer behavior. We work to enable manufacturers and retailers better understand what consumers really want. Our name has inspired trust for over 89 years because we take pride in discovering new pathways to sustainable growth for our clients, our people, and our planet.

We are always looking for open-minded people who will grow with us, push boundaries, and pioneer disruptive methods in market research, data science, technology, and AI. If you share this passion to drive things forward and the integrity to insist on doing things the right way, we'll equip you to take your future into your own hands and play a leading role in our story.

Job Description

С удоволствие Ви каним да се присъедините към екипа ни като:

Специалист маркетингови данни

Каква е целта на позицията?

Да гарантира точността и качеството на маркетинговите данни преди тяхната

публикация, както и да създава нови продукти в съществуващи бази данни – всичко

това в съответствие с глобалните стандарти за качество.

Какво ще правите като Специалист маркетингови данни?


Ще търсите информация онлайн за характеристиките на различни продукти
Ще я категоризирате, класифицирате и актуализирате
Ще въвеждате данните в база или Excel
Ще осигурявате качествен контрол на информацията
Ще управлявате месечната продукция на данни чрез вътрешни платформи
Ще следите сроковете и изискванията на клиентите
Ще се справяте с възникнали казуси и ще намирате решения
Ще следите пазарни тенденции и ще работите със специализирани


приложения


Ще си сътрудничите с колеги от различни отдели и партньори на GfK


Какво очакваме от вас?


Висше образование в областта на икономика, математика, ИТ, управление на


данни или друга подходяща сфера


Готовност за работа на пълен работен ден
Добри умения за работа с MS Office (Word и Excel)
Английски език на работно ниво (минимум B1–B2)
Интерес в областта свързана с обработка и анализ на данни
Аналитично мислене, инициативност и внимание към детайла
Отлични комуникационни и екипни умения
Способност за работа със срокове и постигане на цели


Какво ви предлагаме?


Хибриден модел на работа – два дни седмично присъствие в офиса
Ваучери за храна – 120 лв. месечно
Медицинска и животозастраховка
MultiSport карта (със самоучастие на служителя)
Допълнителен платен отпуск – 3 дни
Менторска програма
Достъп до платформата LinkedIn Learning
Ден за доброволчество и вътрешна програма за признание
Програма за подкрепа на служители (EAP)


Допълнителни предимства:


Гъвкаво работно време и възможност за работа от вкъщи
За еко-пътуващите, безплатно място за велосипеди
Отлична локация на офисът ни в София, в близост до идеалния център и лесно


достъпна с градски транспорт

Ако търсите роля, в която данните имат смисъл, а работата ви има реално

въздействие – очакваме ви!

Благодарим на всички кандидати за интереса. Одобрените по документи ще бъдат

поканени на интервю

Don't meet every single requirement? Some people are less likely to apply unless they meet all the requirements listed in a job specification. GfK is looking for self-starters to join our innovative team keen to take on a new challenge. So, if you're excited about this role but your skills and experience don't align perfectly with every requirement we've listed, we still encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal opportunity in employment which focuses on all of our employees reaching their full potential. We are looking forward to meeting you!

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)
