We show the world what people want.

Join GfK and help us shape tomorrow. As an NIQ company, we are the world's leading consumer intelligence firm, delivering the Full View™ on consumer behavior. We work to enable manufacturers and retailers better understand what consumers really want. Our name has inspired trust for over 89 years because we take pride in discovering new pathways to sustainable growth for our clients, our people, and our planet.

We are always looking for open-minded people who will grow with us, push boundaries, and pioneer disruptive methods in market research, data science, technology, and AI. If you share this passion to drive things forward and the integrity to insist on doing things the right way, we'll equip you to take your future into your own hands and play a leading role in our story.

Job Description

С удоволствие Ви каним да се присъедините към екипа ни като:

Специалист маркетингови данни

Каква е целта на позицията?

Да гарантира точността и качеството на маркетинговите данни преди тяхната

публикация, както и да създава нови продукти в съществуващи бази данни – всичко

това в съответствие с глобалните стандарти за качество.

Какво ще правите като Специалист маркетингови данни?

  • Ще търсите информация онлайн за характеристиките на различни продукти
  • Ще я категоризирате, класифицирате и актуализирате
  • Ще въвеждате данните в база или Excel
  • Ще осигурявате качествен контрол на информацията
  • Ще управлявате месечната продукция на данни чрез вътрешни платформи
  • Ще следите сроковете и изискванията на клиентите
  • Ще се справяте с възникнали казуси и ще намирате решения
  • Ще следите пазарни тенденции и ще работите със специализирани

приложения

  • Ще си сътрудничите с колеги от различни отдели и партньори на GfK

Какво очакваме от вас?

  • Висше образование в областта на икономика, математика, ИТ, управление на

данни или друга подходяща сфера

  • Готовност за работа на пълен работен ден
  • Добри умения за работа с MS Office (Word и Excel)
  • Английски език на работно ниво (минимум B1–B2)
  • Интерес в областта свързана с обработка и анализ на данни
  • Аналитично мислене, инициативност и внимание към детайла
  • Отлични комуникационни и екипни умения
  • Способност за работа със срокове и постигане на цели

Какво ви предлагаме?

  • Хибриден модел на работа – два дни седмично присъствие в офиса
  • Ваучери за храна – 120 лв. месечно
  • Медицинска и животозастраховка
  • MultiSport карта (със самоучастие на служителя)
  • Допълнителен платен отпуск – 3 дни
  • Менторска програма
  • Достъп до платформата LinkedIn Learning
  • Ден за доброволчество и вътрешна програма за признание
  • Програма за подкрепа на служители (EAP)

Допълнителни предимства:

  • Гъвкаво работно време и възможност за работа от вкъщи
  • За еко-пътуващите, безплатно място за велосипеди
  • Отлична локация на офисът ни в София, в близост до идеалния център и лесно

достъпна с градски транспорт

Ако търсите роля, в която данните имат смисъл, а работата ви има реално

въздействие – очакваме ви!

Благодарим на всички кандидати за интереса. Одобрените по документи ще бъдат

поканени на интервю

Don't meet every single requirement? Some people are less likely to apply unless they meet all the requirements listed in a job specification. GfK is looking for self-starters to join our innovative team keen to take on a new challenge. So, if you're excited about this role but your skills and experience don't align perfectly with every requirement we've listed, we still encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal opportunity in employment which focuses on all of our employees reaching their full potential. We are looking forward to meeting you!

Additional Information

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Performance Analyst
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Join our dynamic Operations Analytics Team! As a cornerstone of our organization, this team serves as a one-stop shop for all data analytics needs related to operations and venues. We pride ourselves on our ability to analyze, automate, and guide other teams, functioning as a consultancy/support mechanism. Our work involves close interactions with upper management, contributing significantly to critical strategic discussions. To excel in this role, you must possess a blend of analytical prowess and exceptional communication skills.

What You'll Be Doing


Conducting in-depth analyses using Looker and Excel to support various operational and venue-related teams.
Automating processes to enhance efficiency across departments.
Providing consultancy and support to operational and venue teams to steer their activities based on data-driven insights.
Engaging in regular exchanges with your manager and contributing to strategic decision-making processes.
Preparing reports, occasionally presenting findings through PowerPoint presentations.


Our humble expectations

Must-Haves:


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Fluent English skills, both written and verbalStrong analytical skills coupled with the ability to communicate findings effectively.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.
A proactive attitude towards problem-solving and continuous improvement.


Nice-to-Have:


Proficiency in SQL and Python


Why Join Us?

Join us and contribute to driving the success of our operations through insightful analytics and strategic support. If you have the right mix of analytical expertise and communication skills, we would love to hear from you!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Take your career to the next level with Amaris Consulting as a Data Analyst in Madrid!

Become part of an international team, thrive in a global group with €800M turnover and 1,000+ clients worldwide, and an agile environment by planning the kickoff and follow-up on projects. Join Amaris Consulting, where you can develop your potential and make a difference within the company.







✍️ WHAT WOULD YOU NEED?

1 year with proven experience in data extraction, analysis, and interpretation.
Proficiency with Power BI and Excel (must-have).
Ability to create reports and dashboards from scratch.
Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail.
Proactivity, organizational skills, and ownership of day-to-day responsibilities.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with different departments.
Fluent in Spanish (working language); English is a plus.
Based in Madrid and comfortable with working onsite.
Nice to have (not mandatory, but a big plus): Power Query, Web analytics tools, Adobe Analytics.




👉 WHAT WILL YOU DO?

Extract and process data from various sources to identify insights and trends.
Design, build, and maintain dashboards and automated reports.
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to define KPIs and reporting needs.
Interpret data, identify patterns and business opportunities, and support decision-making processes.
Act as the data point of reference within the team and contribute to data strategy development.
Ensure the quality, consistency, and clarity of data presented in reports.




🚀 WHY US?

Join our dynamic team of talented individuals and experience a world of growth and opportunities. Here's what we offer:

Grow rapidly with a tailored career path and salary evaluation. 70% of our senior leaders started at entry level.
Enhance your skills through our Tech Academy catalog, Udemy E-learning Platform, Language Sessions, webinars, and workshops.
Take charge of your training with an annual personal budget and company-paid certifications.
Enjoy flexible policies, remote work options, and social benefits like transit and restaurant tickets, kindergarten support, and private health insurance.
Benefit from our WeCare program, supporting employees in critical situations.
Unleash your full potential, both professionally and personally.




Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We’ve partnered with a market-leading digital business behind some of Europe’s biggest lottery, charity raffles, and e-commerce gaming platforms — combining technology, marketing, and data to reach millions of users across Germany.




They’re now looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to help elevate how they measure and optimise marketing performance. You’ll lead work on Marketing Mix Models, multi-touch attribution, and incrementality testing — helping ensure every euro of media spend is working as hard as it should.




📍 Location: Hamburg / Berlin (Germany-based, 1x/month in office)

Salary: €60-80k- Dep on Experience!




What You’ll Do

Build and refine MMM and attribution models across all major marketing channels
Run incrementality tests, geo-experiments, and holdouts to measure true impact
Turn data into actionable insights for smarter media planning and budget allocation
Collaborate with teams across CRM, performance, finance, and data engineering
Partner with vendors like Meta and Kantar on measurement and validation
Create dashboards that help teams understand performance and make informed decisions




What We're Looking For

4 years + in Marketing Data analytics
Must have experience with Python or R, and SQL
Must have hands on and proven experience with MMM and attribution modelling
Solid grasp of causal inference, experimentation, and regression techniques
Comfortable working across multiple marketing channels
Clear communicator who can explain data to non-technical teams




Sound like your kind of challenge? Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Randstad Digital, we are based on the excellence of our engineers, and consider our team to be our most valuable asset. Always putting talent first, we support technology specialists throughout their professional lives and ensure that they develop their skills.

We provide varied and challenging career opportunities, as we work with our clients on a wide range of projects in various industries, including Automotive, Heavy Industry, Transportation, Finance, Services, Security and Biometrics, Platforms and IoT, Telecommunications, and Mobile Communications, among others.

Our mission is to be a trusted digital enablement partner that facilitates the accelerated transformation of companies by providing talent, capacity, and global solutions in specialized domains. We support four service lines, including customer experience, digital and product engineering, data and analytics, and cloud transformation, as well as three engagement models, including talent services, global talent centers, and managed solutions capabilities.

Responsibilities:




You will work in agile teams dedicated to developing and maintaining highly critical reporting solutions with complex data models. Your main responsibilities include actively participating in the analysis, estimation, and development of customized solutions for different business units within the company, collaborating with other team members based in Spain and India.




Requirements:




Data analysis using multiple data sources (ERP, CRM, SQL, APIs, etc.).
Design of efficient data models.
Experience with ETL/ELT Processes, ensuring quality and efficiency.
Development of reporting solutions in Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Thoughspot, etc.
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform, mainly Power BI, Power Automate, Power Apps.
Wide experience in collaboration with business partners for collection of new requirements and translation into technical solutions.
Experience in Finance.
Fluent in English.

Title: Data Analyst - Frankfurt - TWE42465
Description:
Location: Germany (Hamburg / Frankfurt / Cologne region)

Employment Type: Permanent




We are working with a Private Equity–backed healthcare organisation in Germany that is undertaking a large-scale Data and AI transformation. With multiple Patient Management Systems across the group, the business is now looking to bring in a Data Analyst to help shape a more data-driven environment and support the integration of new digital tools.




The Role:




As a Data Analyst, you will:

Work with data from a variety of systems (including legacy PMS platforms) and help design a more standardised data model.
Support the development of the company’s central data framework, improving data quality, accessibility, and reporting.
Partner with the business, vendors, and digital teams to deliver actionable insights and enable data-driven decision-making.
Contribute to the rollout of AI-based solutions, such as speech-to-text and eConsent tools, by ensuring reliable and consistent data foundations.
Use tools such as Qlik and other reporting technologies to enhance business visibility and performance tracking.




What We’re Looking For:




Strong experience in data analysis, data modelling, and reporting.
Familiarity with data governance and data quality practices.
Comfortable working across multiple systems, including legacy databases and file-based systems.
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills, able to work with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
Knowledge of healthcare or other regulated industries is a plus, but not essential.




Why Join?




Chance to be part of a major Data & AI transformation from the ground up.
Exposure to advanced digitalisation projects with real-world impact in healthcare.
Opportunity to work in a PE-backed environment with significant investment into technology.
Permanent position offering long-term growth and development opportunities.




If this role sounds like the right step for you, please click apply or reach out to Mihaela Popova at twentyAI.

Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:

Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London
Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training
Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit
An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets
Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley
Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




Analyze client portfolios consisting of leveraged loans and HY bonds
Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for funding
Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems
Work closely with the securitized products structuring team on new issue securitization transactions
Conduct market and asset level research




You have:




BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)
0-2 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm
Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)
Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset
Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English




Team profile




Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (“DLG”) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.

DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.




About Morgan Stanley




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Title: Data Analysis Intern

Location: Dublin, Ireland

Stipend: €2000 - €2500

Company: Nexus IT (Hiring on behalf of a leading IT client)




About Nexus IT

Nexus IT is a specialized recruitment agency connecting top talent with leading IT firms across the UK. We're currently hiring a Data Analyst Intern on behalf of a forward-thinking technology consulting company.




About the Internship

This internship is ideal for recent graduates or early-career professionals eager to build career in data analysis. You’ll work closely with skilled data analysts and project teams on real client engagements, contributing to impactful insights while sharpening your analytical and technical toolkit.




Key Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will:

Assist in collecting, cleaning, and validating datasets
Support the creation of reports and dashboards using tools like Power BI and Excel
Write basic SQL queries to extract and manipulate data
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns and trends
Summarize insights into clear reports and visual presentations
Document data sources, processes, and methodologies
Participate in team meetings and brainstorming sessions




Ideal Candidate

We're looking for someone who is curious, motivated, and eager to grow:

Background in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business, or related fields
Comfortable working with Microsoft Excel for data analysis
Basic knowledge of SQL or strong interest in learning it
Exposure to visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) is a plus
Strong attention to detail and analytical thinking
Good communication skills, especially in presenting data insights
Eagerness to learn and contribute in a team environment




What You’ll Gain

Monthly stipend starting from €2000 - €2500
Fully remote work, with a hybrid option
Performance-based bonus schemes
Coverage of professional membership fees
28 days of annual leave plus bank holidays
Enhanced pension contributions
Access to a 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme offering GP consultations, mental health support, and wellness services




Eligibility Requirements

All applicants must be eligible to work in Ireland. Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor visas for this position.




Hiring Process

We strive to make hiring simple and supportive:

Introductory Call – Learn more about your goals and the internship opportunity
HR Interview – Discuss your background, motivation, and career aspirations
Technical Assessment – Evaluate your analytical approach and basic technical skills

Questions are welcome throughout — we're here to help you succeed.




Diversity & Inclusion at Nexus IT

Nexus IT is committed to inclusive recruitment practices. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are happy to provide accommodations as needed throughout the hiring process. Our goal is to foster a diverse candidate pool for every role we fill.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil, Tunísia e Índia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Formação em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Mais de 4 anos de experiência em funções de Data Analyst;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de SQL Server;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de PowerBI;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (B2 ou superior).


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
An Amazing Career Opportunity for a Business Data Analyst!!

Location: Lanškroun or Prague, Czech Republic

Job ID: 41163

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights that shape business strategy? As a Business Data Analyst, you’ll be at the heart of our decision-making engine, ensuring our data is not just accurate—but powerful.

In this role, you’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams including Product Marketing, IT, Sales, Engineering, and Customer Service to elevate the quality and consistency of our business data across multiple systems. Your work will directly influence how we operate and grow.

This is more than a data job—it’s a chance to become a trusted partner in driving clarity, efficiency, and innovation across the business.

Who are we?

HID powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely.

We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo

Identification Technologies (IDT):

IDT is creating trusted identities for IoT applications through Smart Components and Enabling Services.

HID’s Identification Technologies powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places and things through smart components and cloud services. We make it possible for people and organizations to transact safely, work productively, and travel freely. Our contactless identification and sensing (RFID, NFC, and BLE) components and solution enabling technologies address the dynamic requirements across multiple industries to wirelessly connect, identify, collect and manage data quickly and accurately across virtually any IoT application.







As our Business Data Analyst, you’ll support HID’s success by:

Identifying and resolving data inconsistencies and errors across systems such as Enterprise Analytics platform, Oracle e-Business Suite, Oracle PLM, Excel and other platforms like ERP systems of acquisitions.
Periodically maintaining and improving data integrity for product hierarchies, recurring revenue records, customer types, sales mapping and other datasets.
Developing and managing internal data quality dashboards and reports to monitor progress and flag anomalies.
Collaborating with different teams including central Master Data Management (MDM) department to define data standards & implement best practices for data governance.
Supporting data migration, cleansing, and enrichment efforts during system upgrades or acquisition integrations.
Creating and documenting data quality processes and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
Providing training and support to business users on data quality best practices and the correct use of data systems.
In collaboration with, Master Data Management (MDM) department, suggesting improvements to automated data validation rules and controls to enhance data accuracy at the point of capture.

Your Experience and Background include:

Min. 3 years in business data analytics or comparable fields of work
Degree in IT, Data Management, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field desired but not mandatory.
Previous experience in a data quality, data operations, or business analyst role is preferred
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.
Knowledge of additional languages (such as French, German) is an asset but not mandatory.
Ability to read and interpret technical documents and international standards.
Proficiency in Excel and data manipulation tools. Formulas and Pivot table handling is a must; scripting knowledge such as VBA is desired.
Experience with data platforms such as Salesforce, Oracle, Agile or similar systems is a plus.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC), Tableau) is an asset.
Understanding data governance and data quality frameworks.
Familiarity with operating systems (Windows).
Experience with SSMS (SQL Server) and scripting is desired
Very detail-oriented and methodical with a passion for identifying and resolving data issues.
Proactive and self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and in teams.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Effective collaborator with cross-functional teams.
Fast learner

What we can offer you:

Competitive salary and rewards package
Competitive benefits and annual leave offering, allowing for work-life balance
A vibrant, welcoming & inclusive culture
Extensive career development opportunities and resources to maximize your potential
To be a part of a global organization that is pioneering the hardware, software and services that allow people to confidently navigate the physical and digital worlds

Why apply?

Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to apply.
Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers.
Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted.

HID does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

HID is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that reflects the global communities we serve. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. Our goal is to create a workplace that empowers everyone to thrive and be their authentic selves, fostering an environment of mutual respect and inclusivity. If you have a disability and require assistance or accommodation to participate in the application process or to perform essential job functions, please contact accommodations-ext@hidglobal.com.

Title: ESG Data Analyst
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, present in Portugal since 2007. With offices in Lisbon and Oporto, we specialize in the management, implementation, development, and maintenance of information systems. We partner with over 150 active clients across banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy, and transport sectors.

What are we looking for?

• Actively contribute to the data collection, analysis, and reporting required by the ESG strategy and regulations, working with the ESG Team and under the supervision of the ESG Data Manager

• Work with different business units and departments to effectively collect and analyze ESG data

• Assist the ESG Team in the roll-out of new ESG regulations by ensuring collection of new data points

• Contribute to the preparation of regular internal reporting on ESG-related metrics; assist in analysis to understand trends and where strategic controls are needed

• Maintain accurate databases from different sources of the relevant ESG metrics to ensure the ESG Team and internal stakeholders can answer questionnaires (rating agencies, investors, clients, etc.)

• Be part of the roll-out of the technology solution to manage ESG data collection, performance management, and reporting; support the identification of opportunities for improvement on reporting requirements

• Very good command of English (oral and written)

What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Hybrid from Lisbon/Porto;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • You will grow in good company. Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at maria.t.moreno@aubay.pt!

Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract;

Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for two years period).

The collected data might be transferred or include other processing activities, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law.

For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL’s headquarters in Avenida Duque D`Ávila, nº46 em Lisboa or use the DPO’s e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority – www.cnpd.pt.

(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.)

Title: Data Analyst - Remoto
Description:
En ReCodme, aceleramos el desarrollo tecnológico de nuestros clientes y partners a través de soluciones especializadas, aportando valor a su continuidad y crecimiento.




Creemos en estar cerca de nuestra gente y en el valor añadido que cada persona aporta a nuestro equipo y proyectos.

¡Un ReCoder es un apasionado de la tecnología, la clave de nuestro éxito, la clave de nuestra fortaleza!




Actualmente estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo y formar parte de un proyecto importante, en modalidad de trabajo remoto.




📢 ¿Qué necesitas para ser parte de este proyecto?




Requisitos:

📍 Ubicación: Modalidad Remota.




Idiomas:

Inglés: C1 - Colaboración internacional.




Buscamos un Data Analyst para unirse a un equipo internacional y multidisciplinar dentro de un proyecto de gran escala.

será la clave para impulsar la toma de decisiones basada en datos y respaldar la transformación digital y analítica de la organización.




Requisitos imprescindibles:

+5 años de experiencia en Business Intelligence / Analytics en entornos multinacionales complejos
Máster o grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ciencias de la Computación, Economía, Física u otro campo cuantitativo.
Dominio avanzado de Power BI (dashboards, visualizaciones, optimización, storytelling).
SQL y DAX a nivel experto.
Experiencia en diseño de modelos de datos y análisis avanzado.
Capacidad para gestionar múltiples proyectos simultáneamente en entornos dinámicos.
Inglés fluido (oral y escrito), con capacidad de comunicación efectiva con stakeholders senior.




Responsabilidades principales:

Colaborar con las unidades de negocio para comprender necesidades estratégicas y operativas, transformándolas en soluciones de datos accionables.
Desarrollar y mantener dashboards avanzados en Power BI, asegurando precisión, escalabilidad y experiencia de usuario óptima.
Diseñar y optimizar modelos de datos complejos utilizando SQL y DAX.
Participar en la automatización de procesos de reporting para garantizar eficiencia y reducción de tareas manuales.
Colaborar con los equipos de integración e ingestión de datos para mantener pipelines de datos confiables y de alta calidad (dbt, ETLs, etc.).
Liderar iniciativas de transformación cultural hacia la toma de decisiones basada en datos en toda la organización.
Analizar y validar grandes volúmenes de datos asegurando la calidad, consistencia y exactitud de la información.
Documentar procesos, metodologías y estándares de datos.
Comunicar resultados analíticos de forma clara y efectiva a stakeholders senior y equipos no técnicos.




Requisitos deseables:

Conocimiento en dbt, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics.
Experiencia con Python para análisis y automatización de procesos.
Conocimiento del sector turismo o experiencia en entornos de servicios globales.
Experiencia en cultura data-driven y gestión del cambio en organizaciones complejas.




¿Listo para esta fuerza? ¡Envíanos tu candidatura!




En Recodme, defendemos la igualdad y valoramos la diversidad. Creemos en un entorno seguro e inclusivo, donde todas las oportunidades son equitativas para nuestros colaboradores.

No discriminamos por edad, etnia, orientación sexual, género, discapacidad ni ningún otro factor no relacionado con el mérito.




¡Todas las candidaturas que cumplan con los requisitos son bienvenidas!

Title: Data Analyst F/M/X
Description:
Are you a talented Data Analyst looking to take the next step in your career?

Amaris Consulting is seeking a motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Belgium. This is a fantastic opportunity for professionals with a keen analytical mindset, technical expertise, and strong communication skills to grow and make an impact in a dynamic, multicultural environment.




🔥 Your Role:

Analyze data and create reports to help the business make decisions.
Build dashboards and visualizations to share insights.
Work with different teams to understand their data needs.
Make sure data is accurate and clean.
Present your findings to both technical and non-technical people.




🎯Your Profile:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Good knowledge of SQL and data analysis tools (like Python or R).
Experience with data visualization tools (like Power BI or Tableau).
Team player with good communication skills.
Speak English and Dutch (bilingual) or English, French, and Dutch (trilingual).




🚀 Advantages:

An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.




💡 We are an independent company that values:

Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.







Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Show more
HTML:
Are you a talented Data Analyst looking to take the next step in your career?

Amaris Consulting is seeking a motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Belgium. This is a fantastic opportunity for professionals with a keen analytical mindset, technical expertise, and strong communication skills to grow and make an impact in a dynamic, multicultural environment.


🔥 Your Role:

  • Analyze data and create reports to help the business make decisions.
  • Build dashboards and visualizations to share insights.
  • Work with different teams to understand their data needs.
  • Make sure data is accurate and clean.
  • Present your findings to both technical and non-technical people.


🎯Your Profile:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
  • 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
  • Good knowledge of SQL and data analysis tools (like Python or R).
  • Experience with data visualization tools (like Power BI or Tableau).
  • Team player with good communication skills.
  • Speak English and Dutch (bilingual) or English, French, and Dutch (trilingual).


🚀 Advantages:

  • An international learning environment.
  • Extensive training and certifications.
  • A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
  • The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
  • Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
  • An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.


💡 We are an independent company that values:

  • Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
  • International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
  • Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
  • Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst (BN)
Description:
Company Description

Our mission as a company providing IT services is to provide our clients all over the world with the best solutions. We manage to do this by analyzing the needs of our clients and matching them to the skills and aspirations of our employees. Therefore, one of our main motivations is to provide each Employee and Consultant with a satisfying experience. Joining us means being part of a community with diverse personalities. Start your adventure with act digital!

Job Description


Data modeling, information architecture, and data warehousing, with a particular focus on Data Vault 2.0 architecture
Analyzing and translating business requirements into concrete, value-creating solutions.
Design and implementation of advanced data models based on Data Vault 1.0 and 2.0 methodologies to support business-critical needs.
Development of robust data warehouse architectures that ensure a compliant, scalable, and efficient data foundation.
Utilization of tools such as SQL for effective data processing and analysis to support business objectives.
Acting as a liaison between technical and non-technical stakeholders, capable of conveying complex concepts in a simple and understandable manner.
Problem-solving through analysis of complex data challenges and development of effective, data-driven business solutions.


Qualifications


5+ years of experience in data analysis.
Experience in gathering business requirements.
Experience in designing data solutions architecture from source systems to user-facing solutions.
Experience with data warehouse concepts and ETL processes.
Experience in data modeling, including methodologies such as Data Vault 1.0 and 2.0.
Possesses technical skills and can use SQL.
Experience working on a Cloud Data Platform; familiarity/experience with Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse, and Databricks is a plus.
English min. B2.


Nice to have


Knowledge of the financial sector and experience with data governance is an advantage


Additional Information


Work model: hybrid, Warsaw
Type of contract: B2B


We offer


Access to local and international projects - Clients from France, Germany, Portugal, UK, and Benelux.
Professional development support - trainings, technical certificates, conference participation, foreign language classes, and soft skills trainings are subsidized for up to 2 000 PLN.
Bonus for recommending Candidates starting from 6 000 up to 10000 PLN.
Fully paid Medicover healthcare card.
Psychological support program WellBee.
Multisport card.
Regular integration events and gifts.
Long-term cooperation.
Relocation Program.


If You applied for this position the Controller of your personal will be ACT DIGITAL POLSKA Sp. z o.o., with its registered office at Przyokopowa 31, 01-208 Warsaw. The personal data provided by you will be processed for the purpose of the recruitment process and for future recruitment processes. You will have the right too choose one or both options on next page.

You have the right to access the content of your data, request their rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, the right to data portability, the right to object to the processing of your data and the right to lodge a complaint to the President of the Personal Data Protection Office.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¿Te apasiona el BigData? ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo con una de las trayectorias más solventes en el mundo del Machine Learning, Analytics y BigData? ¿Te apetece trabajar en una compañía joven, participativa y especializada?




Para ello solo exigimos un requisito, que tus respuestas a las preguntas anteriores hayan sido: ¡SÍ!

En Mática Partners, trabajamos continuamente para mantenernos a la vanguardia tecnológica, y además somos una empresa People Centric, ponemos al trabajador en el centro de todo lo que hacemos. Creemos en una cultura horizontal, sin egos, en un entorno donde se valoran tanto las ideas como las personas.




Buscamos a un/a Data Analyst con 2 años de experiencia en análisis de datos para generar insights accionables y apoyar la toma de decisiones basada en data.




¿Qué buscamos?




2 años o más de experiencia con Power Bi.
Experiencia demostrada en DAX (cálculos de medida complejas).
Conocimientos en PowerQuery / M para transformación de datos.
Solidos conocimientos en modelado de datos.
Habilidad en diseño de dashboards atractivos y user-friendly.
Experiencia en manejo de parámetros, slicers avanzados, bookmarks, navegación dinámica.
Experiencia demostrada en conexión a diversas fuentes de datos (Excel, SQL, APIs, etc.).
Comunicación fluida con usuarios de negocio.
Se valorará experiencia en Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power Virtual Agents, Dataverse)
Alto nivel de inglés. Te integrarás en un equipo internacional y tu nivel de inglés debe ser alto, tanto escrito como hablado.




¿Cómo será tu día a día?




Comenzarás cada jornada con una reunión diaria de seguimiento de proyecto donde compartirás avances, bloqueos y próximos pasos con el equipo.
Tendrás autonomía para organizar tu trabajo, gestionando tus tareas y tiempos de forma flexible, con foco en la entrega de valor y resultados.
Participarás en reuniones de equipo semanales para compartir aprendizajes y fomentar la colaboración.
Te reunirás directamente con el cliente para presentar avances, resolver dudas y entender mejor sus necesidades.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido y salario a valorar según experiencia, (nuestro plan de carrera incluye 2 revisiones anuales). También tendrás a tu disposición un plan de formación especializado, participación en la propiedad y los beneficios de Mática: Wetaca gratuito en la oficina dos días a la semana, horario flexible con facilidades para trabajar desde donde quieras, seguro de salud, retribución flexible con Cobee, además de las vacaciones habituales, ofrecemos una semana extra en Navidad y tres días adicionales en Semana Santa. También recibirás un divertido Welcome Kit con portátil (podrás escoger entre varios modelos Mac o Windows), móvil, botella personalizada, auriculares bluetooth y golosinas.

Cuando estés en nuestra oficina, en el centro de Barcelona o Madrid, la fruta, los cafés y los refrescos corren a cuenta de Mática. ¡Ah! Y si eres amante de los animales, te gustará saber esto: ¡nuestras oficinas son Pet-friendly!




Si te interesa, escríbenos por LinkedIn o envía tu CV a anna.garriga@maticapartners.com




Do you want to be Mática?




Be Mática!

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We Are Waiting for You

Hi there!

I am Laura the recruiter for this position (and hopefully, your future colleague!).

First, a little bit about what I like the most about working at ServiZurich: The environment here is incredibly collaborative and innovative. Our tech-driven mindset fosters continuous learning and growth, creating an atmosphere where everyone can thrive. Now, I can't wait to share this exciting journey with you at the Zurich!

Let me take a wild guess: you’ve probably sifted through countless job offers today, and they all seem to blur together. Sound familiar? Well, here’s the scoop: At Zurich, we might not have all the answers (and we’re not striving for perfection!), but we’ve got something special. Curious? Keep reading!

First off, THANK YOU for considering our company. We understand that finding the right opportunity can be tough, but I’ll try to make it easier.

Who Are We?

Let me introduce us. You’re reading about Zurich Insurance Group, a global leader in insurance, but this role specifically pertains to ServiZurich. Established in Barcelona in 2006, ServiZurich operates as an integral part of Zurich Insurance Group, providing cutting-edge technological solutions and support to Zurich's local and global business units.

In addition to our technological solutions, we excel in investment, administration, and accounting, ensuring comprehensive support for Zurich's diverse operations.

What Can You Expect?

Would you like to start your professional career in a multinational environment?

If you’re someone who wants to influence your own development, if you are passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a young and motivated team and help us make a difference, this is your opportunity! We are seeking recent graduates, who are interested in developing their professional career in one of the world’s leading insurance groups through a personalized training and development program.

This position offers you the experience to learn within an international environment providing you support, mentoring and development opportunities in new projects.

And you might be thinking: This is great, what will my day-to-day be like, at Zurich? I’m glad you asked – I asked myself the same question at the time.

In this role, you will be part of the Reporting and Analytics Team within Group Investment Management and perform the following duties:


Design and implement solutions based on data & analytics in Investment Management
Enable the business to draw actionable insights out of complex data sets
Translate reporting requirements into business intelligence solutions
Work alongside experts in various technological domains.
Enhance your skills with real-world experience
Contribute to a team that values your input and creativity.


Your role will involve building relationships with:


Stakeholders on local, regional and group levels
Investment back-office and middle-office teams
Market and Master Data teams
IT teams


What Makes You a Great Fit?

While we’re not seeking perfection or expecting you to save the world, we believe that if you meet some of these requirements, you’ll be a fantastic fit for our team. We are waiting for you!

As a Junior Data Analyst your education and personal skills will ideally include:

Education skills:


Bachelor or Master´s degree in either Finance, Economics, Information Technology and/or quantitative fields such as Statistics and Math with good academic record
Data Science studies are a plus
Fluent in written and spoken English


Technical skills:


Experience with data engineering and analysis
Experience with Power BI visualization tool is a must
Strong coding skills (preferably SQL, Python or Spark)
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Databricks knowledge is a plus
Machine Learning is a plus


Personal skills:


Ability to work with multi-cultural project teams and facilitating workshops with stakeholders
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Creative thinking and intellectual curiosity


The following areas of knowledge would be very helpful to a candidate to successfully fulfil this role:


Knowledge of data analytics including data transformation, modelling, and visualization
Business Analyst skills (e.g., requirement engineering, design thinking)
Understanding of insurance industry, financial products, financial markets as well as the main accounting principles


And… What Makes Us Special?

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus, we offer:


To support your work-life balance, we have adopted a flexible working model.
Over 300 euros to set up your home office and additional monthly home office allowance.
Wide range of internal and external trainings, including English and Spanish classes depending on the needs.
Ticket restaurant and Health Insurance with the flexibility to exchange it for other benefits.
Life and accident insurance.
Collective Life retirement Plan
2000 referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you to the company.
Special banking and insurance conditions plus Exclusive Employees discounts
Functional diversity benefits
Different social clubs such as hiking, investment, beach volley and many more


Where Are We Located?

Via Augusta, Barcelona.

We Are Waiting for You.

It’s a match? Don’t wait any longer! Apply by sending your CV in English.

If not, no worries! We’ll meet again in the future. Feel free to share my contact details with anyone you think would be a great fit.

At Zurich, we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best-qualified individuals available, regardless of race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

ServiZurich– Your Talent, Our Strength

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet.


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: Hybrid
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Laura Santamaría Rodríguez


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Over de functie

Bij Yielder Group werk je als Data Analist (Power BI) op het snijvlak van data en marketing. Je verzamelt en structureert marktdata, borgt de kwaliteit en vertaalt dit naar heldere dashboards en rapportages. Samen met BI en marketing verbeter je processen en help je mee richting te geven aan datagedreven marketing automation. Jouw analyses maken het mogelijk om klantprofielen steeds slimmer en meer geautomatiseerd op te bouwen.




Wat jij zoekt:

Een rol waarin je data echt kan laten spreken
Samenwerken met BI en marketing in een groeiend team
De kans om te bouwen aan datagedreven processen




Wat jij krijgt:

Een marktconform salaris + vakantiegeld
Ruimte voor eigen initiatief en ontwikkeling
Jaarlijkse bonus tot 10% en 50% pensioenbijdrage




Over de organisatie:

Yielder Group helpt organisaties groeien met datagedreven marketing
Werken in een groeiend team met korte lijnen en veel energie
Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en ideeën echt tot uitvoering te brengen




Klaar voor de volgende stap?

Herken jij jezelf in deze vacature of wil je meer weten? Solliciteer direct!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At SpotOn, we’re helping restaurants and small businesses compete and win with flexible payment and software technology—backed by real people who really care. From seamless point-of-sale systems to integrated restaurant management solutions, every SpotOn tool is designed to help local businesses increase profits and create better experiences for their customers and employees.  

Recently, SpotOn was:

Named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies of 2024
Awarded Great Places to Work and Built In’s Best Workplaces for the third year in a row
Selected as the Best Overall Restaurant POS by NerdWallet 
Rated the top-rated point-of-sale (POS) for restaurants, bars, retail, and small businesses by Capterra users

We’re committed to caring hard and moving fast so that we can continue to grow and make a positive impact together. 

That’s where you come in. 

On a daily basis, you will:

Analytics Genius: Serve up impactful data-backed recs with a focus on predictive modeling and statistical analysis driving strategic decisions and business growth.
Data Transformation: Identify relevant data sources, validate/reconcile data, and build concise and future-proof models designed for adaptability and scalability.
Automation Mastermind: Get to the bottom of data discrepancies and outdated manual processes to ensure smooth operations using machine learning and data pipelines.
Churn Crusader: Dive deep into why merchants are churning, figure out "what happened," and use those insights to help us improve, employing advanced segmentation and predictive analytics.
Understanding causality: Partner with our customer support team to understand the customer sentiment. The goal is to be able to link past interactions during onboarding, past go-live and using our software features to retention and upsell successes.
Team Up: Collaborate with Finance, Operations, Sales, and Product teams to maintain a reliable data infrastructure and contribute to data science initiatives.

What You'll Bring:

5 years of experience in data science, business analytics, payments, finance, statistics, or a related field.
Willing to come into our Kraków office 2-3 times per week.
Strong SQL skills (ability to write complex queries to extract insights), experience with BI tools, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R.
Operating with a bias toward sharing, transparency and collaboration is your default!
Diving in, solving problems, and getting things done is second nature - no waiting for perfect conditions.
Thriving in fast-paced environments, embracing ambiguity, and taking initiative without a rulebook.

Perfect candidate also has: 

Experience in accounting, finance, or SaaS.
Flexibility with working hours, ideally availability from 1 PM to 9 PM.

Here’s a bit about what we have to offer:

Competitive pay: 11000 - 15500 PLN gross on CoE.
Training budget 3500 PLN gross per year.
Access to e-learning platforms (O’Reilly).
Fully paid private healthcare in LuxMed.
Access to the Worksmile platform with a monthly top-up.
Company free breakfasts/lunches in the office once a week.
Group English classes with a native speaker.
Dell Latitude and whatever tools you need.
New, modern, bright and comfortable office space in the city centre.
A lot of free parking spots around the office.
Access to the company’s library.
Great working atmosphere.
Chill out room with a PlayStation and games.
Free snacks and beverages in a kitchen.
Company parties and social activities.
Employee referral program.
Relocation Package within Poland.

 

 

The controller of your personal data included in your job offer and others collected during the recruitment process is SpotOn Poland spółka z ograniczoną odpowiedzialnością with its registered office in Kraków, Aleja 29 listopada 20, 31-401 Kraków, e-mail address:
poland-rodo@spoton.com. We will process your personal data for the purpose of current or, if you voluntarily agree, also future recruitment processes. More information about how we proccess your data, including the basis for processing and your rights in relation to the processing, can be found on our website: https://pl.spoton.com/privacy-and-cookies-policy.

Recently, SpotOn was:

  • Named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies of 2024
  • Awarded Great Places to Work and Built In’s Best Workplaces for the third year in a row
  • Selected as the Best Overall Restaurant POS by NerdWallet 
  • Rated the top-rated point-of-sale (POS) for restaurants, bars, retail, and small businesses by Capterra users

We’re committed to caring hard and moving fast so that we can continue to grow and make a positive impact together. 

That’s where you come in.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work within Customer Engagement Analytics team in Spain, to provide technical expertise in Advance/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. The key responsibilities of the role will be to contribute to AbbVie Data Analytics projects and support Data Science projects. Should be highly analytical with love and high affinity for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Additionally, not only should be familiar with quantitative methodologies and programming but also keen on business acumen. The Data Analyst should have passion for data analysis, data quality and accuracy, data exploration, machine learning and out of the box thinking.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as a relevant member of Customer Engagement Analytics, working in close partnership with the rest of team member and Global Winning with Data team to implement global and local initiatives in the affiliate, becoming a trusted partner of the CEx local team.

Develop in collaboration with the commercial teams and other CEx teams, advanced analytics, identify synergies, optimize reporting strategy to generate business relevant outcomes.

Master in different Foundry datasets of varying complexity and size levels and develop new ways to generate creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.

Identify best practices and extend them to the rest of the organization in terms of repoting & analytics, Proactively identify new analytical approaches that would improve our ability to answer key business questions, by closely collaborating with key business partners to transform key business questions to insights.

Work with business stakeholders to define key business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives and success factors for winning with data initiatives.

Qualifications

BS degree in mathematics, statistics or engineering, computer science or economics complemented with a master in Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science or equivalent.

Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications.

Minimum of 2 years of applied data science in fields such as data engineering, predictive modelling,

Experience developing and executing data analytica to address key business questions with positive and measurable outcomes.

Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally and externally generated data sets.

Essential skills:

Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen and creative problem solving.

Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally or written) to all levels of the organization.

Ability to be agile and nimble changing business conditions, strong collaborative relationships, teamwork across different functions and teams to contribute to productive culture.

Lead strategically and create trust within the team.

Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Aftermarket
Description:
Data Analyst Aftermarket
Bydgoszcz, Poland
SPX Flow – Globally And Locally
SPX FLOW, Inc. manufactures and supplies engineered flow components, process equipment, and turn-key systems. The Company offers 20 brands of pumps, valves, mixes, air dryers, hydraulic tools, homogenizers, separators, and heat exchangers, filtration solutions as well as aftermarket parts and services.
SPX FLOW serves food and beverage, health, and industrial manufacturers, bringing together trusted brands and technologies to meet new consumer expectations and anticipate industry trends. Many of your household goods & favorite snacks may have been created with the help of SPX Flow solutions.
SPX Flow has been established for over 100 years! Headquartered in North Carolina, we have operations in more than 25 countries and a broad global customer base. Our 5000 employees worldwide innovate to design, deliver and service high-value solutions for our customers.
As a world leader in sustainable solutions, we’ve launched projects at our facilities to save energy and reduce waste, and we engineer efficiency into our products and technologies to help our customers do the same. We currently hold more than 550 patents worldwide, and roughly 44% of them are related to sustainability and clean technology.
SPX flow at Bydgoszcz, Poland is looking for Data Analyst
About The Role
We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a passion for data analysis, problem-solving, and a desire to make an impact within our organization. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with our managers to support the collection, processing, and analysis of data to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions.
About Your Responsibilities At SPX Flow

Gathering, cleaning, and organizing large sets of data from various internal sources
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track key business metrics
Define, implement, and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess Aftermarket and Supply Chain performance
Conduct basic statistical analysis to support data-driven decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and business needs
Generate ad-hoc reports and insights based on business requests
Help improve data collection processes and ensure data integrity
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices related to data analysis
Be involved in internal data projects with company wide impact

About You

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field
3+ years of experience in a related role within an industrial or manufacturing environment
Proficiency in Excel experience with SQL is a plus
Proficiency with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Proficiency with SAP 5&6 / HANA
MS Office knowledge mandatory
Knowledge of basic statistical methods and techniques, Lean Six Sigma qualification is a plus
Very good English skills in spoken and written (business fluent)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new tools and technologies
Know how within Incident-, Problem- and Change Management
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team

About Your Benefits

Performance & recognition programs.
Bonus structures (depending on company and personal performance).
Family friendly policies.
Genuine progression and development opportunities with a global organization.
Healthy minds and healthy lives resources.
Retirement savings plans with company contributions.

About The Company Globally
At SPX FLOW, sustainability is more than a buzzword. It’s a way forward. We improve the world through innovative, sustainable solutions. 
Check out our sustainable solutions here: here
We put people first, creating opportunities for everyone, and we give back to our communities too. Our team members are what make SPX FLOW special.
Next steps?
Does it sound as your next job? Be our solution in the making and apply now!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure’s growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role’s relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization’s growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2–3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly. 

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline. 

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it’s a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously. 

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another’s strengths, investing in and developing our team’s capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company’s DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.
 

Show more
